Live in in the heart of Little Tokyo and the Arts District with other international travelers, visitors, and residents!  Sogo Residence is a historic brick building that has served Los Angeles travelers for over 100 years. neighborhood_overview: Little Tokyo is the most vibrant area of downtown Los Angeles, with authentic Japanese eateries, markets, and stores.  Don't miss Sushi Gen for sushi or Daikokuya for ramen.  The Arts District is nearby as well, with plenty of cafes, art galleries, and street art to view, as well as some of the best restaurants in LA.  Favorites include Bestia and Manuela, and Salt & Straw for ice cream.

name: Historical Arts District
description:
Come stay in the India room in the heart of the famous Arts district

The space
Stay in the India room in an artists loft, close to Union Station and Disney Concert Hall. Private room with queen size bed, sleeps 1 .kitchen access, largr bathroom. Laundry facilities available in the building, cafes, bars and lots of yummy food in walking distance. Free Wifi available. The bed is memory foam :)

Guest access
All common areas

Other things to note
There is not a hard door to the room
Sometimes a kitty comes to visit. Please let me know if you have any allergies. The space is shared with three other people all artists :-)
neighborhood_overview: Amazing Murals and cafe's all around.
host_about: I'm an actress, poet and compassion seeker. I love my neighborhood and my loft.

name: En Vogue Modern Loft DTLA, Arts District
description:
This is a spacious and modern loft in the heart of the Arts District, fully furnished with authentic parts of movie and TV shows sets. Original early-1900s loft architectural details including heavy timber beams, columns, pipes and wood floor.

The space
All the amenities are included:
- Kitchen has quartz counter-tops, dishwasher and garbage disposal.
- 1 bathroom with quartz counter-top and over-sized soaking tub paneled by glass door.
- Laundry closet with washer and dryer.
- High speed internet WIFI.
- 55' LED TV with access to on demand movies and TV shows library.

Guest access
You will access:
- Rooftop with pool, spa, fireplaces, bbq, private cabanas and lounge chairs overlooking the skyline.
- Fitness center with floor-to-ceiling city views.
- Landscaped courtyard featuring a water garden, decorative lighting, fireplace and seating areas for dining and conversation.

All the a
neighborhood_overview: The Arts District is today the center of the arts and cultures who are influencing and renewing all the City of Angels. The loft is across the street from the Urth cafe' and all the attractions within the Arts District and Little Tokio including museums, music center, theaters, pubs and restaurants. You can go shopping to the coolest and trendiest shops now in town such as Dover Street Market, Warby Parker, Poketo, Hennessey + Ingalls...all walking distance, or grab a coffee at the Cafe' Gratitude, Groundwork Coffee, Blacktop Coffee or Blue Bottle Coffee. If you wanna have some bites, Urth is always open for you and you can also walk to Pie Hole, Wurstkuche, LoQui, Eat Drink Americano, Frizzi, the Little Bear and the Daily Dose Cafe. Also you'd be lucky to stay close by the most renowned restaurants in town such as Bestia, Kitchen Factory, Officine Brera, Sixth and Mill, Cha Cha Cha, Bavel, Manuela, Church and State, and Zinc. Pubs? No worries...The Resident, Death & Co., Tony's Saloon
host_about:
Hi!
My name is Riccardo. I am Italian from Milan and I moved here in Los Angeles in 2005.
I simply love this city. Los Angeles always made me feel free, happy and since I am here in Downtown, more balanced.
Because I grew up and have been raised in a city like Milan, after few years I started to miss the authenticity of this city and finally I found it here in Downtown LA! 
I always love to share my place and my free time with all my friends and, I can tell being here helps a lot.
I work in the entertainment industry, I frequently leave for days or weeks and for this reason I can share my place with cool people that are visiting here.  That would be my blessing to welcome you to DTLA and to experience  the core of the City of the Angels.

LENGTH OF STAY - We gen
neighborhood_overview: Live in the Arts District, in downtown Los Angeles. Located on First and Hewitt, the Sogo Hotel is only two blocks from the Little Tokyo Gold Line metro stop and on the same block as the downtown Dash A line. Major freeways are very close.  The Arts District is one of the most exciting parts of downtown LA, full of galleries, great coffee, restaurants and bars.
host_about:
Zack Z. very much enjoys the arts–music especially. On the off time he (tries) to play guitar and puts his six years of choir and music theory into use. Aside from working online in the perpetually changing internet scene, Zack also works closely with his wife on artistic projects that will hopefully be the foundation of their traveling dreams together. 
 
Melissa M. is the epitome of hip and fresh.  A printmaker at heart, she thrives on the tactile that is paper. Together with this love of paper, and skills attained, she creates handmade artists books, prints, and stationery that evoke a thoughtful cuteness. 

Mel and Zack are a unique couple: met in high school, best friends for years, sharers of tragedy and fun times, singers of many a song, married immediately and always working on a mystery since then. 

The ultimate goal for them (and most 9 to 5'ers) is to make a living off doing what they both love. 

They hope to travel the world for extended periods of time and spread joy the only way they know how: funky dancing, loud singing, nonstop comedy and making pretty things.


OUR LISTINGS

Check them all out here: https://www.airbnb.com/s?host_id= (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and our 10 bed place in a church here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6836730. Also our newest 3 bedroom house, here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/10775684

They are mostly all in the hippest part of Los Angeles, a place called Silver Lake (Northeast of Downtown). Homeplace of Beck, Elliott Smith, moustaches, The Silver Lake Reservoir, and heck, that dork pretty boy Ryan Gosling lives here too.

We've had the chance to meet and host the following artists and bands: Tame Impala, Blood Orange, Kurt Vile, American Football, Kimbra, King Tuff, The Movielife, Kopecky, Kate Nash, Slow Magic, Digitalism, Tanlines, Cathedrals, Lemaitre, The Stooges, Wild Feathers, Bronze Whale and more to come.

Some properties are owned by us but a few are also managed by us. Don't be surprised if we introduce you to a bff or a second mother of ours =)

Read our reviews and come join the fun!

name: Spacious DTLA loft by LA Live!
description:
Fully furnished 1200 sqft 2bd/2bth loft located in the heart of the South Park neighborhood in Downtown LA. Conveniently located 2 minutes walk to Staples Center, LA Live, and the LA Convention Center.

The space
Stay a few minutes walk from the Financial, Garment, Jewelry, and Bank Districts! Also very close to City Hall, Union Station, Chinatown, El Pueblo - Olvera Street, Pershing Square, Walt Disney Concert Hall, and MOCA museum. And in the center of LA you have immediate access to the 10, 101, 110, and 5 freeways to easily drive anywhere else in Southern California!.

----------------Loft Highlights and Amenities----------------

** Huge 2 bedroom 2 full bath open floorplan space with beautiful hardwood floors

** 2 secured underground parking spots (trust me convenient parking is rare downtown!)

** Guest stays of a year in length include full access to the brand new amenity deck in the AVEN building next door with gy
host_about: I have a great passion for traveling as well as hosting guests from overseas and showing them my town.  Naturally, I needed to become an airbnb user!  I've been exploring Europe lately; visited Italy, Spain and France last year and currently planning a trip to Portugal and Morocco.  I get a lot of guests from all over visiting Los Angeles and since I've been here all my life I make for a great local resource!!

name: DTLA Open Studio Loft w/Exposed Brick
description:
Make a temporary home in a place that's as charming and as cool as I'm assuming you are.

The space
Spacious studio loft in the Fashion District. Walking Distance to GREAT dining, shopping and entertainment, including the following sights and attractions: Pershing Square, Metro Train Station, Grand Central Market, Target, Staples Center & LA Convention Center, MOCA, Walt Disney Concert Hall, and the Fashion District.

Building includes 24 hr. SECURITY in lobby.

My loft is PROFESSIONALLY CLEANED for every guest.

AMENITIES include a stainless steel kitchen stocked with dishes and cookware.

State of the art digital amplified/surround sound entertainment setup which includes 3D TV and glasses, PS4 and Apple TV. Ideal for those nights you wanna get up close and personal with your entertainment without leaving the comforts of the couch or your significant other.

On the ROOF DECK access includes a beautiful skyline v
neighborhood_overview: Located in the Fashion District of downtown LA.
host_about:
I'm a busy man with a hand or foot usually always out the door. I enjoy a variety of things that don't always include the finer things in life. However; clean bathrooms and impeccable kitchen standards are necessary.

Conversations are always a plus but common sense and a penchant for jokes really tip the scales.  

With that said, looking forward to sharing my home and tastes with you! Tschus

A wonderful modern 650 sq ft. studio loft in the heart of the Arts District of downtown Los Angeles. The Arts District is nearby as well, with plenty of cafes, art galleries, and street art to view, as well as some of the best restaurants in LA.  Favorites include Bestia and Manuela, and Salt & Straw for ice cream.
host_about:
Zack Z. very much enjoys the arts–music especially. On the off time he (tries) to play guitar and puts his six years of choir and music theory into use. Aside from working online in the perpetually changing internet scene, Zack also works closely with his wife on artistic projects that will hopefully be the foundation of their traveling dreams together. 
 
Melissa M. is the epitome of hip and fresh.  A printmaker at heart, she thrives on the tactile that is paper. Together with this love of paper, and skills attained, she creates handmade artists books, prints, and stationery that evoke a thoughtful cuteness. 

Mel and Zack are a unique couple: met in high school, best friends for years, sharers of tragedy and fun times, singers of many a song, married immediately and always working on a mystery since then. 

The ultimate goal for them (and most 9 to 5'ers) is to make a living off doing what they both love. 

They hope to travel the world for extended periods of time and spread joy the only way they know how: funky dancing, loud singing, nonstop comedy and making pretty things.


OUR LISTINGS

Check them all out here: https://www.airbnb.com/s?host_id= (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and our 10 bed place in a church here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6836730. Also our newest 3 bedroom house, here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/10775684

They are mostly all in the hippest part of Los Angeles, a place called Silver Lake (Northeast of Downtown). Homeplace of Beck, Elliott Smith, moustaches, The Silver Lake Reservoir, and heck, that dork pretty boy Ryan Gosling lives here too.

We've had the chance to meet and host the following artists and bands: Tame Impala, Blood Orange, Kurt Vile, American Football, Kimbra, King Tuff, The Movielife, Kopecky, Kate Nash, Slow Magic, Digitalism, Tanlines, Cathedrals, Lemaitre, The Stooges, Wild Feathers, Bronze Whale and more to come.

Some properties are owned by us but a few are also managed by us. Don't be surprised if we introduce you to a bff or a second mother of ours =)

Read our reviews and come join the fun!

name: Cartwheel Loft in LA Arts District
description:
This is an authentic live/work artist loft space, originally an 1890 furniture warehouse, with 15' ceilings and maple-wood floors, located in the Downtown LA Arts District.

At check-in, you'll receive a printed neighborhood map, published by my art magazine. I'll customize it for you, with food and activity suggestions.

As an experience curator and tour operator, a private guided tour is also available for you and your guests!

Looking forward to the possibility of becoming your host soon!

The space
A unique opportunity to experience a 1550 square foot live/work loft space while being surrounded by an incredible art collection that includes many contemporary emerging street and outsider artists.

I'm a professional tour guide in the neighborhood and extremely passionate about what the Arts District, DTLA, Little Tokyo and Chinatown and for that matter all of LA has to offer. If your interested, I will provide insider ti
neighborhood_overview: The Downtown Los Angeles Arts District is one of the most unique and art-centric neighborhoods in LA. It is changing rapidly and constantly in the news. If it's art your into, you'll find over thirty galleries, museums and art centers in addition to over 100 murals! There are so many great restaurants and artisan businesses as well! Coffee roasters like Stumptown is my neighbor and so is the Bread Lounge who distributes bread and bakery goods to the neighborhood restaurants so you wont need coffee at the loft..  (Note: I'll be writing more here to update the listing soon but this is a basic overview for now)
host_about:
I'm the founder/publisher of Cartwheel Art, a digital art magazine, and founder/director of Cartwheel Art Tours, a speciality tour operator that designs and leads custom immersive art and neighborhood tours, throughout Los Angeles and beyond.

I attend art openings and cultural events often. I'm also very connected to the art community as well as with neighborhood organizations. I serve on the board of our neighborhood council.

Although I love to attend art and music festivals as well as music shows, they've taken a back seat in the last three year's while I've been focussed on the expansion of my company with tours. 

The same has occurred for traveling except to destinations where there are art fairs such as Miami in December with Art basel (SCOPE Art Fair my favorite). My favorite past travel destinations have been internationally Bali, and in the U.S, Seattle. I've also spent quite a bit of time in Joshua Tree here in CA as well as France, where my sister has lived with her family for close to 30 years. I'm originally from NY and went to college in Massachusetts so the east coast is definitely in my blood too and I love to visit there as well. I was raised visiting Haiti when I was younger as my parents had an art gallery that was located in the beach community of Jacmel.

On my bucket list with travel would be destinations for good street art such as Berlin and Brazil, as well as places where there are old buildings that have interesting details. My favorite's are weathered, rusty and old industrial type buildings that have lots of layers and textures.

Activities I like to participate with in order to have balance in my life outside of work includes yoga, biking, hiking and snowboarding. 

I live a healthy lifestyle and love my green juices 

Laguna Beach was my hometown until seven years ago when I moved to LA. Although, I still like to go spend time there with with family and friends. 

I have my BS degree in Hospitality Management and  worked for many years with the hotel groups: Joie de Vivre, Marriott and The Ritz Carlton. The boutique hotels of Joie de Vivre are my favorite hotels and while being a Cultural Ambassador for them, I loved staying at many of their unique locations. 

With my background in hospitality, interest in art and in addition to providing tours in my neighborhood, you can be assured that your stay will be comfortable and I will connect you to all of the events and the neighborhood. You will leave feeling like a real 'insider" of the Downtown Los Angeles Arts District--one of the most unique art-centric and rapidly changing neighborhoods in Los Angeles.

name: Chic, Modern Downtown Loft
description:
My 1100sqf loft has a poetic feel & is located in one of downtown LA's coolest, and oldest buildings. Soaring ceilings, beautiful concrete floors, and pleasing lighting create a special charm—at once chic, comfortable & hushed. Enjoy rooftop pool, Jacuzzi and 360 city view.

My loft has been called a "zen urban sanctuary of literature and rock n roll" due to its earth-toned hues, books, rock photography, Balinese teak furniture, pleasing lighting, candles and a dash of exoticism.

The space
Originally built in the 1930s, my historic building was one of LA's first skyscrapers.

My loft, twice the size of The Ace or Standard Hotels, has been called a "zen urban sanctuary" due to its soft, earth-toned hues, dark teak furniture, pleasing lighting, books, candles and a dash of rock n roll. Together, they create a space that's a calm sanctuary.

License number
Exempt - This listing is a transient occupancy residential structure
neighborhood_overview:
The great thing about living here isthat it is the epicenter of downtown living. Restaurants that can be walked to include: Coles French Dip, Phillipe's French Dip, Bar Ama, Perch, Botegga Louie Pete's Grill, Rocket Pizza, Gorbels, Blossom, The Redwood, Wurstkuche, etc. Bars include: Bar 107, Cosmos', Golden Gopher, Casey's Irish, Las Perlas, Varnish, 7 Grand, etc... A short walk will also find you in Little Tokyo, Downtown LACMA and the MOCA, The Disney Music Hall and The Dorothy Chandler Pavilion and Cathedral Of Our Lady Angeles. 3 minutes away from Union Station.
Show more
Edit
host_about:
I am a lover of books (Henry Miller, Christopher Hitchens, Simon Winchester, Tim Cahill) architecture, rock n roll (The Doors, U2, Sigur Ros, Ryan Adams, David Bowie) magazines (Vanity Fair, The New Yorker, Dwell, MONOCLE, Afar) Bali, London, Big Sur, Tibet, film noir movies, photography, journalism and good bourbon.

I've always liked these two sayings: Be kind because every soul you meet is engaged in a great struggle.....and...Life isn't about finding (Website hidden by Airbnb) about creating yourself.

When I travel, I like to mix up nice, elegant hotels and rustic b&b's. Atmosphere and mood is everything.

name: Modern Luxury in Historic Downtown!
description:
Modern one Bedroom located in Downtown LA's Historic Core. Double paned windows, washer/dryer, rooftop pool, gym and much much more! Building has 24 hour security and is conveniently located near some of the coolest restaurants and bars in the city!

The space
This amazing apartment is only 3 years old but sits among Downtown's most beautiful historic buildings. It's amenities include:
-Central air and heat
-Bamboo floors (berber in the bedroom)
-TV with Hulu and Netflix access
-Wireless TURBO internet
-Double pane windows (noise proof)
-Drafting desk for all your art projects
-Computer desk/wireless printer
-Record player (with mp3 hook-up)
-Full kitchen with stainless steel cookware (feel free to cook!)
-Dishwasher
-GIGANTIC bathroom with UNLIMITED hot water, accompanied by high end face/hair products
-Full size washer/dryer
-Super comfy queen sized bed.
-Espresso machine (with Illy coffee an
neighborhood_overview:
Christmas lights hang between the 100 year old buildings right outside your window. You'll be staying on the very street Wyatt Earp drove a stagecoach 150 years ago. This is the neighborhood that Charlie Chaplin - among the other early greats - lived and worked. This area has a beautiful history, and is also in the middle of a major resurgence. Named as one of LA's coolest neighborhoods, this apartment is in the middle of (art) Gallery Row and is within walking distance to:
-Amazing restaurants, bars/clubs, and coffee shops (when I say "amazing" I mean life changing)
-Museums (MOCA, Geffen, Broad to name a few) as well as countless art galleries.
-Historic walking tours
-Fashion District (amazingly cheap boutique clothes)
-City parks (Grand Park, Spring Street Park, Pershing Square and Angels Flight)
-Little Tokyo (Sushi!), Chinatown and the Art's District.
-A ton of music venues ranging from Jazz to Punk.
-New and historical theaters (Walt Disne
host_about: My name is Jeoff. Originally from Montana, currently living in California. I work in Film and television... which also happen to be my hobbies. I also enjoy literature, art, theoretical physics and of course traveling! I think airbnb is a great thing. In a time when it's very easy to become physically disconnected through technology, airbnb is helping people forge new relationships and providing a great service to both parties financially. I look forward to more adventures, and meeting great people along the way!

Friendly international vibe with lots of young professionals, students and travelers.

Furnished private room available for short stays or long-term. Some of our
neighborhood_overview: LOCATION: Live in the heart of the Arts District, steps from Little Tokyo, in downtown Los Angeles. Located on First and Hewitt, the Sogo Hotel is only two blocks from the Little Tokyo Gold Line metro stop and on the same block as the downtown Dash A line. Major freeways are very close.  The Arts District is one of the most popular neighborhoods in all of Los Angeles, with hip retail stores and great restaurants.  Little Tokyo is your go-to spot for authentic Japanese food, museums, and pop culture.

neighborhood_overview: Little Tokyo is historic and clean and part of Downtown Los Angeles. There are no buildings taller than 5 stories to maintain the sense of community.  There are people walking around all day especially at meal time. If you are into quality sashimi, Sushi Gen is the best restaurant in town and is adjacent to the condo.  Little Tokyo is right between the Arts District and the Historic Core.  You cannot find a more convenient and safe location in Downtown LA.

name: Modern, Spacious Downtown LA Loft!
description:
Chic, brand new open-plan loft set within the highly sought Arts District. Features many original details including exposed brickwork, 17ft ceilings, 15ft windows, state of the art kitchen and a rooftop pool with stunning panoramic views across LA!

The space
The space features many stunning original features including exposed brickwork, 17ft ceilings, beams and gorgeous 15ft windows allowing ample sunlight (and blackout shades!) The view from the roof is breathtaking and one of the finest vantage points in the city. The loft features chic, designer furniture, state-of-the-art Jenn Air appliances, a queen bed with memory foam matress, oversized tub, 42" HD TV with Netflix, Nest controlled HVAC, in-built washer-dryer, free high-speed wifi and a host of other amenities. Located in the trendy Arts District in downtown LA, the space is walking distance to many popular bars and restaurants including Urth Cafe, Wurstkuche, Bar 82 and Zinc. 24hr security, parking and ex
neighborhood_overview: The Arts District is home to some of the world's most renown artists. There is a unique sense of neighbourly community here. My loft is within walking distance to some of the finest bars, restaurants and clubs in the burgeoning Downtown Los Angeles nightlife scene. The Geffen Contemporary, Little Tokyo, Urban Radish grocery and Urth cafe are within easy walking distance. Exchange, The Standard and Ace Hotels are only a short ride away.  The facilities at LA Live are also a short cab ride away.
host_about:
Easy going, laid back, professional working in the music industry. Split my time between London and LA and travel all over the world working. Love California and all it has to offer.  

My favourite cities have got to be Melbourne, San Francisco, Seoul, Tokyo, Berlin and my home town of Belfast, Northern Ireland.

name: Penthouse Living at a Hip, Renovated Loft in the Heart of LA
description:
We have significantly reduced prices for extended stays to support traveling medical professionals & first responders.

We’re working hard to keep our Abodes safe and open to anyone who needs them. Check-in is seamless, with no lines to stand in or people to meet to ensure our guests can limit their interaction with others. We are implementing rigorous additional cleaning and sanitizing procedures before and after each stay, providing extra soap in the homes for personal hygiene, and fully stocked with cleaning supplies and paper goods. Our team is dedicated to assisting our guests and are available at any time, day or night.
neighborhood_overview: Parking not available, however, we do have a paid garage we can recommend to guests, located less than 1 block away. Parking rates subject to change.
host_about: My name is Alex and I am the co-founder and head of guest experience at Abode. Abode was founded with one goal in mind, to provide travelers the feeling of home wherever they may go. Whether for work or leisure, Abode provides artfully designed and furnished homes that allow our guests to live like locals, but with all the amenities and services of a boutique hotel.

name: Stylish Retro Loft in Downtown!!
description:
Come stay at our funky spot! This two bedroom one bath truly is a work of art, with 25 foot ceilings, exposed brick in both bedrooms you will definitely feel right at home in the heart Downtown LA!

The space
Our apartment is unlike any loft you've ever seen, and definitely what sets it above the rest. It can comfortably fit 4 people with 2 queen size beds. Both of the bedrooms are inspired by our personalities, the lower one resonates the theme of "psychedelic cowboy" with it's tiedye bedspread, and cattle insignia on the walls as well as string lights, candles and succulents that frame Downtown LA's sky at sunset. The upper loft is a larger creative space; it flaunts beautiful hard wood floors with a cozy bohemian vibe. Our living room is where our personalities mesh with an ode to the 70's; watch a movie on our tufted blue velvet couch or read a book on our huge orange shag rug that feels like heaven!

Guest access
All guests will have acc
neighborhood_overview: Our loft is perfectly situated right on Spring and 7th street which is where all the galleries are located for art walk. You are within walking distance to many amazing restaurants, galleries, clothing stores, as well as the metro and Pershing Square, Walt Disney concert hall and a very short drive from Korea Town, Olivera Street and China Town... The list goes on! Downtown is an amazing up and coming neighborhood that offers travelers something that rest of LA does not... History!!

host_about:
I'm all about those positive vibes and good times! People & Travel are my greatest passions and I strive to be a woman of the world. Getting to know cultures and people from all walks of life puts a huge smile on my face. I always try to travel like a local (that's where you find the best food, music, and scenery). Music is my meditation; I can't help but get lost in the sounds! On my spare time I love exercising my creative muscles by crafting/building awesome things. I'm a sucker for rooftops, extra dirty vodka martinis, pizza, a good book, and dinosaurs.

My life motto: Life is for Love
(Not just the romantic kind! But you should love the life you live & all that it encompasses!)

name: 6 Month Minimum Stay -- Downtown Los Angeles LOFT!
description:
Hello! Welcome to the Arts District in Downtown Los Angeles! The 1,150 square foot loft has 16 foot ceilings, gorgeous natural light, a view of downtown, and is fully furnished.

The space
The loft is 1,150 square feet with 16 foot ceilings. It's an industrial space so all the piping and brick is exposed. There is gorgeous natural light that shines through a full wall of windows! It's also newly furnished with brand new pieces and a handful of refinished ones too.
Furnishing include: stainless steel kitchen appliances (industrial sized refrigerator), custom-made Caeserstone kitchen island with counter stools (brand new from Ballard Designs), Salvaged Wood dining table (seats 10), couch, arm chairs, two bookshelves, brand new queen sized bed (with storage drawers underneath!), refurbished desk (it was my father's very first desk when he began his career), High Def TV, DVD player, vent-less and stackable washer + dryer and custom closets (built into the wa
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to The Arts District!
We are east of Downtown Los Angeles, east of Little Tokyo and west of the LA River. The area of formerly abandoned industrial buildings has become a thriving mecca for young professionals in creative industries, including L.A.'s huge TV and film industry. The building is zoned for live+work -- and my owners do live and work from home.
There are local markets, eateries and coffee houses all within a few blocks. I love my neighborhood!
host_about:
Greetings!
I am an LA native and head up finance for a digital media and technology company.  I carefully styled my loft in a classic, rustic, and clean aesthetic.  The stainless steel appliances are new, the furniture is brand new or newly restored, the dining table is one-of-a-kind salvaged wood and seats 10, and the desk belonged to my father who gave it to me and I had it refinished in classic whitewash.

I'm looking for a professional single or couple and respectful tenant who will take good care of my loft while I am away.  

Just send me a note to get started.

Thanks so much,
Kelly

name: Level ◆ One Bedroom Deluxe Corner Suite
description:
Level’s Downtown Los Angeles suites are the personal sanctuary that you’ve been looking for! Your modern suite is more than luxurious and spacious; they are meticulously cleaned with the highest standards for your peace of mind. We are proud to announce that the cleanliness of our suites have rightfully secured Level the GBAC STAR™ facility accreditation. A daily destination amenity fee of $28 plus the City Hotel Tax of 15.5% will be added per room, per day up to a maximum of 30 days.

The space
These executive suites offered by Level are sophisticated in every which way. Embrace your inner epicurean in our fully-equipped gourmet kitchen. The floor to ceiling windows boast remarkable city views whether you enjoy outside from the private balcony or inside while you’re lounging on our modern designed furniture. It doesn’t stop there, make a splash in the outdoor heated pool and soak up some rays or hit up the state-of-the-art fitness center or Peloton® room before c
neighborhood_overview:
It’s no secret that the booming Downtown Los Angeles area is home to countless breweries, coffee shops, and restaurants. Let’s not forget it is also home to L.A. LIVE, Dodger Stadium, STAPLES Center, Los Angeles Convention Center and much more. All with easy access to the 405, 110 and 101 freeways. There is no shortage of entertainment when you're visiting the City of Angels. In fact, the majority of events held in Los Angeles happen right here in Downtown.

If you’re feeling adventurous, try these local hot-spots!

SoulCycle

name: Huge, lovely flat in heart of DTLA
description:
Well furnished, master bedroom with private bath, exposed brick, and king bed in a 2300 sq ft, 12th story loft in heart of DTLA's historic Old Bank District. Subway+Bus nearby. Roof access w/ incredible skyline view, full kitchen, Wifi, +perks

The space
Huge master bedroom (15 x 15) w/ king sized tempurpedic mattress, private bath, three large windows, AC, walk in closet, full sized writing desk. Corner unit.

Living area is a unique space, one of the only Old Bank buildings in Downtown Los Angeles to leave its floor plan in place = 2000 sq ft of open living space with exposed brick, huge windows, an indoor garden (!), stereo hifi, books, victorian wood/leather furniture.

Guest access
Access to common kitchen, living room, dining table, indoor garden areas. Stereo, Washer+dryer.

Private master bedroom, private bathroom.

Other things to note
Loft is contains two other private rooms that s
neighborhood_overview: We're in the middle of everything!  The Old Bank District is a short walk to Staples Center, LA Live, Little Tokyo, City Hall, Grand Park, Disney Center, Financial District, Flower/Toy/Fashion Districts.  Bars and restaurants on our block, extending far two directions.  Lots of fun shops, boutiques, book stores, salons, coffee.  From our roof there is a beautiful, up close view of the DTLA skyline.

name: Cabin in the Sky
description: My place is close to West Hollywood / Beverly Hills. Set in the beautiful rolling Hollywood Hills / Laurel Canyon, this cozy​ Cabin house is peaceful and serene. Great place​ to​ relax and take in the ​hillside away from​ the city noise. Sunset and West Hollywood are​​ just 5 minutes down the hill.  You’ll love my place because of the views. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids)
amenities: ["Long term stays allowed"]

name: Hip 1BD/2BD in the heart of DTLA
description:
Private room with private bathroom in a 2bdrm apt.
-Center of DTLA, one block from the Metro Red/Purple Line, and walking distance to many restaurants, bars, galleries, and entertainment.
Fully loaded kitchen, rooftop pool and gym.
Postive vibe

The space
My place is full of good energy and creativity. I keep it clean and cozy. Your room is simple, but very clean and comfortable and has musical instruments around if you get the urge to jam.
I love to cook, so the kitchen is fully stocked and there for your use at any time.

Guest access
Not including my room, you have access to the entire place. Please make yourself at home. Kitchen, large desktop Mac computer, 54" flat screen tv, rooftop pool, gym, and laundry are all ready and waiting to be used. I also have two brand new bikes you are more than welcome to use.

Other things to note
Parking is $7 a night with the building valet, but sometimes
neighborhood_overview:
I live on the boarder of South Park and the Financial District of downtown LA. Which means you are walking distance to anywhere you want to go in downtown. The Disney Concert hall is .8 miles away, and if you don't feel like walking, you can hop on the train one stop away.
Staple center is a 10 min walk and all the great restaurants and bars range from a 1 minute walk away to just over a mile.
The Arts District is an 8 min bike ride or a $4-10 lyft ride.
The neighborhood is probably the safest in downtown. There is a lot of light at night and businesses around that are open late.
Walking distance to a nice grocery store and Walgreens or Rite Aid.
The are has a great mix of artist, foodies, students, smarty pants, and always a few randoms mixed in. Everyone is welcome.
host_about:
Hello!
I'm a Voice Over actress and wellness/self care enthusiast. I also make music in my free time and love to travel.  I went to Culinary school in my early 20's and worked as a private chef for a few years, so I'm a big foodie.  
 I'm really easy going and love life.  
Things that make my heart happy:
-A nice city or mountain hike
-German Techno
-strong cocktails , followed by a delicious meal
-cooking for friends
-Staring at the moon
-traveling
-art, film, music..
OK honestly, this list can just get ridiculously long. 
 You get the point.

name: Arts District Loft Overflowing with Books and Natural Light
description: Soak up the creative vibes at this flowing 5th-floor loft with huge south and east-facing windows with views of the 4th Street Bridge. Rustic concrete and hardwood floors are combined with original art and limited edition prints and photographs.
neighborhood_overview: The loft is just a stone's throw from everything in both the Arts District and Little Tokyo. Explore the industrial landscape, then walk the 3 blocks to the Little Tokyo metro station and reach Union Station in less than a mile.
host_about: I am a photo producer for advertising.  Born in Boston, college & 20's in NYC, and now long settled in Los Angeles.  I travel for both work & pleasure and love to get to know a new city.  I have an excellent sense of direction and an encyclopedic knowledge of restaurants;) Ask me for suggestions I love to share.

name: Charismatic Corner Loft Studios With a Balcony
description:
Our photography studio and film location is an open floor plan 1000 sq ft loft, featuring brick walls, concrete floors, art deco balcony, and two walls of windows bringing an incredible amount of natural light throughout and breathtaking historic Downtown LA city views.

Inclusive in a rental cost, our studio is decorated with photogenic combination of high end modern and antique furniture, as well as large variety of props.

The space
Some of the key features include:

- Corner view
- Fire escape style balcony
- Exposed brick
- Vaulted ceilings with exposed appliances
- Rooftop with pool and 360 degree city view available for the additional rental fee
- Additional storage available on the same building premises for the additional rental fee

- Two full bathrooms with oval baths and contemporary appliances
- High end furniture, consisted from Restoration Hardware, Pottery Barn and antique pieces
neighborhood_overview: It is conveniently located close to all major freeways and within walking distance of major stores, cafes and restaurants.

name: Luxury Loft across Staples Center
description:
Location is everything in L.A.! This newly built studio loft is located directly across the Los Angeles Convention and Staples Center. It boasts a luxurious pool, spa, and gym with a rooftop overlooking Downtown L.A.! Enjoy your stay in DTLA!

Guest access
- Complimentary Hi-Speed Wireless Internet access
- Electronic keyless entry
- Non-Smoking building
- Central heating and air conditioning
- Modern kitchen
- Stainless Steel Appliances w/ Gas Burner Cooktop
- Large stainless steel refrigerator
- Energy Efficient Dishwasher
- 46" Flat Screen Smart TV w/ basic cable & Show Time Channel
- Complimentary Kuerig gourmet coffee bar
- Large private patio/balcony with a spectacular views of Downtown Los Angeles skyline
- Spacious walk-in closet
- Clean Bathroom with bath tub and shower
- Full-size/full-load Frigidaire® Washer & Dryer
- USB charging ports
- Sofa in the living room

name: Live/Work Space Sublease
description:
I am renting out my room in my 2000 sq ft artist loft in the Arts District of DTLA. I also have a big desk and artistic work space available for use. The room available is the upstairs loft, filled with natural light and a lot of space!

The space
Huge warehouse with a loading dock that is always open. In the middle of thriving Arts District near downtown LA. A projector TV the size of a wall, small outdoor patio, big open kitchen, pool table, hammock, letterpress machine, desks, art.

Guest access
Your bedroom, common area, patio, kitchen, bathroom. All but the other bedroom.

Other things to note
I have a dog Tala and a cat Bam. Both obviously the "cutest dog and cat in the world".
neighborhood_overview:
Google it :)

But you will never have to leave the neighborhood. Walking distance from some of the best restaurants in the world, gyms, coffee, bars, movies, galleries, salons.. You name it.
host_about: Traveling with my laptop. Working on developing cool shit along the way from anything graphic design related to building web apps and sites.

name: Large modern Downtown LA loft
description:
This is a 900 sq ft loft with a bedroom, tons of windows, and beautiful details: high ceilings, brick walls, hardwood floors, and two marble European-style bathrooms. Modern appliances including dishwasher, microwave, AC, and a washer/dryer inside the unit!

The space
This is a beautiful airy space that I really love... It's modern and spacious but cozy. Located on the 12th floor (just below the penthouse), the sunrise/set view is breathtaking and the loft is located on the quiet side of the street.

Guest access
It has a basic gym in the basement and a lovely rooftop pool and jacuzzi with great views of downtown LA! Plenty of parking lot options around the building

Other things to note
This is the perfect place for a small family, couple, or young single professionals looking to experience downtown LA living without compromising on comfort or cost.

Ample cooking space and utilities (feel free to use my wide
neighborhood_overview: This feels like New York living because you'll be in a super pedestrian neighborhood. There are at least five options for good coffee right outside the building, not to mention all the great bars and restaurants! Short waking distance from a very wide range (price/scene) of nightlife spots, and awesome people watching!
host_about:
I am an all-around lovers of life: People, food, travel, films, and music. (notice that food is #2) 
I'm always on the go, traveling in europe, the middle east and Africa, sometimes on a job, but mostly because hey, life is short and I don't believe in the old adage "theres nothing new under the sun"... Like you i'm sure!

name: Modern loft in historic building
description:
Our beautiful loft has exposed brick and a great view of the burgeoning scene downtown Los Angeles. Rooftop access with a pool and jacuzzi in the historic core of downtown.

The space
Open area with air conditioning and breathless sunsets just a small ride up the elevator.

Checkout is 12pm.

Guest access
You'll have access to the rooftop pool, the gym, and the ping pong table.

Other things to note
Because of the bustling neighborhood it can be a bit loud at times but you can close the windows and turn on the air conditioning and it will go away.
neighborhood_overview: Close to subway walking distance to my favorite street in all of downtown...Broadway. Broadway once rivaled Broadway in New York and sold more than rodeo drive and is home of the original United artists and theater palaces. Can take a walking tour to get to know the area

name: Los Angeles Loft w/ Free Parking & Fiber Internet
description:
Recently renovated studio loft in the historic core of DTLA. Magnificent views, modern design, a coveted downtown location ideal for entertaining and exploring "the next great city".

The space
Stay in the heart of the city in an recently renovated building with all the comforts of home. We keep our place clean, organized, and minimalistic, so you'll enjoy the time you spend in the loft. We will provide you with clean linens and towels for your stay. It really is our oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of downtown. Pictures give you the feel of the space. We love it and know you will too!

Guest access
This will be your home while you visit. We will not be around. We are looking for you to have everything you would enjoy from a nice hotel, but with more character and adventure behind it. Complete access to building amenities including; rooftop pool, gym, jacuzzi and underground parking spot with remote access.

Other things to not
neighborhood_overview: Tons of great entertainment and great restaurants/bars within walking distance. No need to go drive around to find the fun. You're already there!
host_about: I'm an adventure seeker building a business in the automotive industry.

name: Stunning 12th Floor Loft in DTLA
description:
Furnished loft (940 sq feet) on the 12th floor of a renovated historic building in the heart of LA's coolest neighborhood. Windows on three walls with stunning views. This is our home and is available only between 1 July and 31 December 2020, while we are away. There is a 60 day minimum stay, which means Long Term cancellation policy automatically applies. Our preference is to find a tenant who has used and been reviewed on Airbnb in the past. Hope to hear from you!

The space
Very sunny apartment, with exposed varnished concrete floors and historic marble panelling in hall. Furniture and belongings are from all over the world. One bathroom with tub-shower. Gas stove and oven, microwave, dishwasher, full-sized fridge. 31" Smart TV connected to Internet and DVD player (sorry no cable!). One queen-sized bed, antique table desk with office chairs. Additional folding desk and chair available. Wifi included.

The house is full of books, and if you have an i
neighborhood_overview:
Great neighbourhood! Walk to the best bars, restaurants, Whole Foods & Ralphs, museums, Disney Concert Hall, LA Public Library.

Little Tokyo, the Arts District, Chinatown, and Koreatown are all adjacent.

An excellent guide for places to eat is Jonathan Gold’s online list of the 101 Essential LA Restaurants. We personally love Baco Mercat at 400 S. Main Street.
host_about: I am a humanitarian worker and independent researcher. I have worked for over ten years with the United Nations in international development and humanitarian assistance, and have lived for extended periods in Yemen, Sudan, Lebanon and the Palestinian territories. I love photography and I have a passion for the Middle East. I moved to Los Angeles three years ago, to join my husband who teaches History of Architecture here at the university.

name: Downtown LA loft pool & subway
description:
Stay in downtown LA amidst of all the happenings and goings on. You'll never be bored in this neighborhood. Restaurants, shops, parks, bars/clubs and culture galore. Literally steps (10 giant steps) away from the Pershing Metro Station.

The space
This is a studio loft so there is no separation between the living room, kitchen and bed room. It's comfy and cozy and comes with a full kitchen and bathroom including free laundry facilities. Perfect for 1 or 2 guests who want a cool retreat from the heat of downtown LA. We do live in this space so expect our personal stuff to be visible. This is not just a rental unit.

Guest access
On the property there is a rooftop pool/hot tub, rooftop lounge areas and a gym. Guests will have access to all of these. At street level of the building there is a convenience store, subway station, coffee shop and pharmacy.

Other things to note
We have 2 dwarf hamsters that will be in
neighborhood_overview: This is a colorful street in downtown.  Lots of characters stroll the sidewalk as is common in LA.  We have a 24 hour doorman/security so you need not ever feel unsafe.  Within walking distance are clubs, bars, restaurants, parks, shops, LA Live, Little Tokyo and Chinatown.  Just a short drive is Echo park, Silver Lake, Sunset, the Arts District and Hollywood.

name: Downtown Los Angeles Bohemian Penthouse
description:
A vibrant and beautiful penthouse located in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles, with a Bohemian & Caribbean feel. It is truly an oasis in the midst of a city! My Penthouse is two stories, with a spacious and decorated balcony with mountain and city views, cozy hammocks and seating area to relax and unwind, along with a rooftop pool/jaccuzi with an amazing city view. The apartment is a short walk to major attractions in the city, Staples Center, bars and restaurants, museums, and parks.

The space
Huge, spacious, modern, two story penthouse in the heart of the historical downtown Los Angeles. Walking distance to many museums, bars, restaurants, the Staples Center/Nokia Theater, as well as the metro. Apartment comes with central heat & air conditioning, private balcony, hammocks everywhere, a rooftop pool/jaccuzi in case you want to relax, and other amenities included below. Hummingbirds come to visit balcony daily! A private bedroom upstairs with a cal king bed,
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of downtown Los Angeles, within walking to distance to plenty of entertainment and nightlife, as well as a 20 minute-30 minute drive to major beaches such as Santa Monica, Venice, Hermosa Beach, Malibu, and Manhattan Beach.  The MOCA (museum of contemporary art) and The Broad Museum are walking distance, as well as Staples Center.  The Arts District, Little Tokyo, Chinatown, Koreatown, is a 5 minute drive, and Hollywood is 15 minute drive.  I am also close to local parks that are amazing to walk through and relax.  I will offer my local tips on where to go and what to see!
host_about: Hello! Hola! Buon giorno! I'm originally from the Dominican Republic, lived there for a few years as well as New York City, city boy at heart, but love the countryside as well. I'm a young professional pursuing a MFA in Creative Writing, living in downtown Los Angeles, passionate about life, love, music, and traveling and meeting new people. I'm very welcoming, friendly, and enjoy making people feel at home, as that's how I was raised, and love using Airbnb when I travel myself.  Welcome to my home, your home, and have a great time experiencing new cultures, and everything Los Angeles has to offer!

name: Modern Loft in Heart of Downtown LA
description:
Sun-lit modern loft with exposed brick and 10ft high ceilings. Views of beautiful street art. The building is located in a vibrant historic neighborhood, and the apartment includes wifi, TV, modern kitchen, deep soaking tub, and washer/dryer.

The space
The apartment is in a historic building that has maintained it's charm while offering modern, luxury amenities. The walls and floors are soundproofed to eliminate noise from neighbors and give you a quiet living space. The apartment has a modern gourmet kitchen, exposed brick walls, huge windows that allow plenty of sunlight, a washer/dryer combo, super-fast wifi and cable TV. The apartment also has a deep-soaking tub where you can relax in the evenings after a long day. The building has 24-hour security/doorman. **The large painting is no longer in the apartment but all furniture is the same :)

Guest access
The building has a beautiful common space lounge with free wifi, flat screen TV and a
neighborhood_overview: The building is in the downtown LA historic core. The neighborhood is full of fantastic bars and restaurants, art galleries and nightclubs. There is a great wine and craft beer store downstairs and a farmer's market across the street on Sundays. There's a ton of stuff going on within a one block radius. It's also within walking distance of LA Live, Staples Center, Little Tokyo, Grand Park, Walt Disney Concert Hall, the Music Center and Chinatown. If you like a city with constant energy and if you like to get around on foot, you will love it here.

name: Luxury Downtown 1BR LA Apt
description:
Luxury one bedroom Apartment in downtown LA. With close highway access and great restaurants and bars in close proximity. Luxury amenities in complex. Several swimming Pools, Jacuzzi, Grocery Store, fitness center, Sauna, and Pay for Parking.

The space
750 sq.ft one bedroom apt. fully furnished with pull out mattress in living area. Large outside balcony. Apartment is in great location close to pool, hot tub, gym, sauna, and parking garage.

Guest access
Entire apartment and all amenities. Key is required to use amenities.

Other things to note
Enclosed parking garage (recommended) available for a daily fee of $10 and/or metered street parking.
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown LA. Downtown has a lot of nightlife and many great restaurants and bars to choose from. Apartment is close proximity to restaurants, bars, and nightclubs. About $4-5 Uber to most places, but it is walk-able.
Some stores just across street such as Wal-Mart (Market only), Burger King, CVS, Starbucks, Papa Johns and Subway. The apartment complex has a grocery store that is accessible from inside the building.

$3-4 Uber ride into nightlife area.
* Union Station within walking distance.
* Short walk to Chinatown. 1 mile to Little Tokyo (incredible Japanese food and stores)
*Staples Center less then 2 miles away. Uber recommended.
*Close to Disney Concert hall and the Broad Museum.

name: Inexpensive Room in Downtown Loft
description:
This is a private bedroom in my loft space in the Arts District of Downtown LA (DTLA).
Queen size bed with tempurpedic mattress.
Lots of light, rooftop access, and easy access to Little Tokyo and Arts District, and Staples Center and LA Convention Center.
Room is Available at various dates throughout the Summer.

The space
This is a loft located in the Arts District of Downtown LA. The room is part of a build-out within the loft. Its an open concept. The room has no ceiling, so noise privacy is limited. But the room is private.

Plenty of space to feel at home during your stay. You will have access to all areas of the loft.

The building is fairly quiet, and there is 24hr rooftop access for sunbathing or relaxing. I have a quaint area above my unit you can chill in.

The local area has some of the best restaurants, bars and cafes in downtown. Local eats and treats: Daily Dose, Little Bear, Pour Haus, Zink Caf
neighborhood_overview:
The local area has some of the best restaurants, bars and cafes in town. Just a few blocks away are: Daily Dose, Church and State, Little Bear, Pour Haus, Zink Cafe, Bread Lounge, Stumptown, Smorgasburg @ The Row (Sunday Only), Blue Bottle, Pizzanista, Bar 82, La Reyna Taco Truck, Urth Cafe, Bestia, Cafe Gratitude, Wurstkuche, Black Top Coffee, Pie Hole, Angel City Brewery, Van Leeuwen, and Bestia.

For shopping there is Poketo, Alchemy Works, Wittmore, Malin+Goetz, Black Milk, Apolis, Guerilla Atelier, and Arts District Coop.

Groceries and Spirits: Joe's Convenient store, Silverlake Wine, Urban Radish, and Little Tokyo Mall (has a wonderful grocery store located on the ground flr).

Also located just 5mins or less from the all the major freeways. Union station is a $4 uber/Lyft ride from the loft. And, I'm a block from the bus stop into center Downtown, and other parts of LA.

name: Artist Studio at the Loft Theater.
description:
The Space

Located in Fashion District, near Spring street and heart of DTLA.
The private bedroom includes a loft sleeping area and nice leaving room. Its an artist gallery and studio.
Fresh linens and clean towels are provided.

The space
The private bedroom includes a loft sleeping area and a leaving room. Room has a vibe of a lounge art gallery/studio.
I would love my guests to enjoy it, respect it, treat it as their own and have the most amazing experience and stay in DTLA.
Fresh linens and clean towels are provided.

The loft is 9000 sq ft and there are several full time tenants living here. We share an open kitchen, 2 bathrooms, washer/dryer, and the beautiful lounge areas. As our guest you are welcome to use any of these areas.

This loft is not a newer updated space like so many trendy buildings in DTLA right now. This is a space that was created piece by piece over the years by the artists who have li
neighborhood_overview:
Loft is located in the heart of the Fashion/Fabric District. A designers dream of every kind of fabric, trims, threads, and needles. At the end of our street is Santee Alley, 3 blocks of discount shopping. We are 2 blocks from the California Mart and the Ace Hotel. Spring street has Art Walk every second Thursday of the month. There are many great restaurants, clubs and entreatment in the neighborhood. Great museums and architecture.

Downtown LA has so much to offer to its visitors, travelers, and locals. I personally love living here and would love you to enjoy your stay!

Airy and well lit, you have access to all shared spaces including a fully equiped kitchen, furnished dining area, a large bathroom with bathtub / shower, and in-unit washing machine and dryer. You will be comfortable staying in our living room where you have the option of sleeping on our comortable, new, red couch or an airbed (upholstry will be provided). The living room and dining space are well kept and extremely comfortable. The highlight of our space, however, is our cute little balcony with seats to en

neighborhood_overview:

neighborhood_overview:
Make no mistake about DTLA, it is an exciting city full of life but... Homelessness is a fact of life here. Whether you stay in our building, a hotel, or anywhere in downtown Los Angeles, they will be noticed. Our building is a vintage, less sound-proofed artist loft. We have mostly 5 star ratings, but there are a few guests who don't quite understand what it means to reside in the heart of a big city like DTLA! Those of us who choose to live here, absolutely love it! Within our immediate 2 blocks we are surrounded by quality bars and restaurants, the historical theatre district, and even a Whole Foods grocery store 5 minutes away.

Come and enjoy it with us!

The BEST DEAL in the Historic Core of Downtown Los Angeles! Located a few blocks from the Metro Subway, Fashion District, and next door to restaurants, pubs & clubs! 2-3 blocks from The Regent Theater, Tower, Orpheum and Los Angeles Theater! Walk to; WHOLE FOODS, ACE HOTEL, THE STANDARD, SHERATON, MILLENNIUM
host_about: An award winning film maker who spent 30 years writing, producing and directing in Hawaii. Returned to Los Angeles for my mom. Wrote a novel and screenplay titled "In the City of Angels" a dark tale of redemption. This was inspired by directing a dozen mini documentaries in Skid Row while also walking 2,000 miles a year across the city of Los Angeles. I really do love DTLA! The Heart of Downtown Los Angeles.

The space
Penthouse 2 Story 2 Bedroom Pool Hot tub Sauna & Gym in art gallery row downtown LA. Marble floors/ concrete polished floors. 2 balconies both floors. Artist penthouse, amazing decor, art everywhere. Beautiful Space to relax or entertain. neighborhood_overview: Wonderful people,dog friendly. Artistic, cool neighborhood vibe.
host_about: We love hosting people and want people to enjoy our beautiful penthouse in downtown Los Angeles. We have an art gallery and are involved with a couple businesses that empower people, art, wine and fitness.  We absolutely love living in downtown Los Angeles, the people, energy and vibe is super chill.  Everything is walkable or a short uber ride. You can have anything delivered for your convenience.  There is an amazing farmers market with restaurants at Grand Central Market. Located right next to Exchange LA night club, which hosts some of the best world known DJ's. There's a dog park just down the road and Pussy & Pooch around the corner do an amazing job grooming your furry one and they have a social hour for dogs & owners.  Artisans, Ace, Perch is super cool for food and drinks, with tons of happy hours. Downtown LA now has bikes on the corners you can rent.  Check out Mel's Sandwich place across the street from the parking garage, best sandwiches ever!!!! LA Live with People Choice Awards, sports, concerts, restaurants, movie theatre, bowling are only few blocks away. Enjoy your stay and ask me anything. Sport events.. we have everything!  I also have an art gallery/studio a mile away if you are an artist and would like to rent that out as well. I provide a bottle of wine or champagne for you upon your arrival with a few breakfast items as well. We want you to enjoy your stay  Best, Jamie & Ryan

neighborhood_overview:
The Arts District is the heart of downtown LA. There are plenty of restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and incredible street art right out side our doors. Little Tokyo is just a block away, and is filled with food, a museum, cute stores, and a bowling alley.

Getting Around

The closest Metro is Little Tokyo (across the street), and anything you could want to see downtown is within a mile of the location (Staples Center, Disney Music Hall, LA Live). Hollywood, Dodger Stadium, Pasadena are all a short metro or bus ride away.
host_about:
I've lived in LA since 2004, am president of my neighborhood council, freelance production jobs (camera op and editor), but best of all, I co-live at PodShare.

PodShare is a live/work community across multiple addresses, where staying at one location grants you access to our other locations for the duration of your stay (during the hours of 10am to 11pm) to share common areas like co-working tables, kitchen, showers, lockers, WIFI, bikes, computers, green screen, sound booth etc. in Hollywood, Downtown LA (Arts District, Venice Beach and Los Feliz.

description:
*Based on the COVID-19 pandemic, we have taken extra steps in disinfecting our homes. We have a zero-contact, self-check-in process. Our concierge service is still available 7 days a week for remote assistance!*

Famously rented by Katy Perry, Kelly Rowland, St. Vincent, and more! Host celebrity-style gatherings in this artfully converted 1926 vaudeville theater. Invite guests into the contemporary chic living room and serve dinner at the expansive dining table. Explore the many hidden seating nooks both inside and out!

Follow us on Instagram @kimsingtheatre for more photos!

License number
HSR20-001723
neighborhood_overview: This completely re-imagined estate retains original details such as bow truss ceilings and the neon theater sign. Feel the charm of Chinatown and the convenience of downtown simultaneously. Directly adjacent is a coffee shop and clothing store!

Walking distance to the hottest clubs and bars. LA night life at your doorstep. Cozy and modern DTLA loft.

Pool and jacuzzi on the rooftop. Gym in the basement.

name: Level ◆ Three Bedroom Executive Suite + Balcony
description:
Level’s Downtown Los Angeles suites are the personal sanctuary that you’ve been looking for! Your modern suite is more than luxurious and spacious; they are meticulously cleaned with the highest standards for your peace of mind. We are proud to announce that the cleanliness of our suites have rightfully secured Level the GBAC STAR™ facility accreditation. A daily destination amenity fee of $28 plus the City Hotel Tax of 15.5% will be added per room, per day up to a maximum of 30 days.

The space
These executive suites offered by Level are sophisticated in every which way. Embrace your inner epicurean in our fully-equipped gourmet kitchen. The floor to ceiling windows boast remarkable city views whether you enjoy outside from the private balcony or inside while you’re lounging on our modern designed furniture. It doesn’t stop there, make a splash in the outdoor heated pool and soak up some rays or hit up the state-of-the-art fitness center or Peloton® room before c
neighborhood_overview:
It’s no secret that the booming Downtown Los Angeles area is home to countless breweries, coffee shops, and restaurants. Let’s not forget it is also home to L.A. LIVE, Dodger Stadium, STAPLES Center, Los Angeles Convention Center and much more. All with easy access to the 405, 110 and 101 freeways. There is no shortage of entertainment when you're visiting the City of Angels. In fact, the majority of events held in Los Angeles happen right here in Downtown.

If you’re feeling adventurous, try these local hot-spots!

SoulCycle
This isn’t your average workout, it’s a lifestyle. And if you like challenging yourself, enjoy unique playlists and thrive under motivation then this is the place for you. SoulCycle is conveniently located in the same building as your LEVEL suite.

Sakana
You’ll dine in confidence knowing that your fish is hand-selected daily by chefs with decades of experience. And don’t worry if you’re new to the sushi scene, the knowled
host_about:
LEVEL offers nightly, weekly, and monthly short-term stays in Chicago, Los Angeles, Vancouver, and opening in summer 2021 in Seattle, that combines hotel-style services with the comfort of residential living. Our luxurious fully furnished suites are thoughtfully designed, have 24-hour concierge support, and have everything you need while being situated in the most vibrant city neighborhoods. Stay well, stay level.  
 
To learn more about LEVEL please visit (Website hidden by Airbnb)

name: Funky DTLA Loft
description:
My place is great for anyone looking to explore lively Downtown Los Angeles. Minutes away from museums, amazing restaurants, vintage movie theaters, concert venues, and unique shopping. Close to the train and multiple highways so getting to the beach or West LA is very easy. Gym, pool, and hot tub on the roof of this 13 story building also ensure your stay will be relaxing and entertaining.

The space
The bedroom is on the second floor of a lofted apartment. There are curtains covering all openings, however the actual room itself does not have a door, just a staircase with a covering curtain.

Guest access
You will have access to two bathrooms, the kitchen, living room, bedroom, and private patio.
neighborhood_overview: Gallery Row is a great part of downtown as it has tons of art galleries and an art walk once a month. The flower district, jewelry district, and fabric district are all walking distance and very fun places to explore. I would be more than happy to offer suggestions of good places to eat as well!

Airbnb n
neighborhood_overview:
It's gritty and real. Heavy vibe and musical history behind the area. Located adjacent to Skid Row and Little Tokyo. Incredible secure 3 story building with roof access. Private Rooftop has 360 degree view of the city!

NOTE: If homelessness makes you feel uneasy, you may want to try other accommodations, as there are many shelters in the area, and the homeless population can be uncomfortable to some.

That said, the place and area are safe and I’ve never experienced any issues in regards to the safety of the area in my 3 1/2 years living, working, and running Airbnb here.
host_about:
I'm a musician/guitarist/songwriter,  living and working in Downtown LA, here in this historic brick building (1908) with so much spirit and history , it’s fascinating. 

Its where where the locals still have heart, regardless of their economic position, and where music reigns supreme.  Over the last 3 years I’ve lived here, I’ve spend most of my  time playing, writing, recording songs in my room,  doing my best to fix the place up, lending a hand to my neighbors/community, listen to music, meeting new guests that come thru, and relaxing with my kitty, Serafina. 

I'm originally from San Diego, but I've lived in LA for 20 years and consider it home for good.

I do my best to make sure all guests are well taken care of, and that they have a great time.

neighborhood_overview:
The Mikado is located smack dab in the middle of Little Tokyo.

Amid the intense activity of Downtown Los Angeles' current development boom, the 132-year old community of Little Tokyo has emerged as one of L.A.'s coolest places to dine, shop, find entertainment, and live.

Charming, walkable and friendly, Little Tokyo is setting a new, more relaxing pace and invites everyone to experience its charm sometime soon. Visitors will find dozens of delectable food options, great bars, live performances, world-class museums, and shopping that is not only eclectic but also affordable. It is no wonder that new residents are moving into the area every day, and visitors in increasing numbers are discovering Little Tokyo's many hidden gems.

host_location: Los Angeles County, California, United States
host_about:
Hi, I am the Founder of Heather's Angels. Since 2015 we have helped nearly 250 hosts launch & run their Airbnb businesses. We welcome 150+ guests from all over the world each month!  We believe that traveling reminds us that we are more alike, than different & everyone belongs.

Whatever brings you to town - our guests rave about "The Angels" fast responses as you are planning your trip. We provide you a neighborhood & city guide to help you make the most of your time with us,  live assistance from people that actually know the home, attention to detail, 5 star cleanliness guarantees for each stay (if you aren't happy with any part of the clean we will come back & redo, no questions, no charge), seamless check-in / out. Book today & experience 1st hand why Heather's Angels has a cult like following.

About me? I've lived all over & whatever you want - LA has it!!!  I have special spots spread throughout each neighborhood.  I love to play tourist in my own city & am thrilled to share my recommendations on what makes LA amazing (and what to avoid)!

Welcome, make yourself at home XOXO Heather's Angels

name: Luxury 1 BD apartment with Balcony/ Prime Location
description:
Come stay in this luxury 1 bedroom apartment and enjoy all the amenities my building has to offer!! Bright and spacious space with private balcony. Get cozy and enjoy weekend getaway or long stay.

The space
This luxury 1 bedroom apartment is the perfect place to call home base while exploring LA with your group. Great alternative to staying in a great location! The apartment is in close proximity to everything including the gorgeous Walt Disney Concert Hall, the iconic Grand Central Market- the European-style food hall built in 1917, beautiful Grand Park, the Staples Center, the original LA Flower Market, the Griffith Observatory and much more.

Guest access
Kitchen, Pool, Gym, Balcony, Lounge Area, Library

Other things to note
Shoes off policy!
neighborhood_overview:
Neighboring the Staples Center, Theatres, Fashion District and Pershing Square. Walk to historic Spring St., have lunch at Grand Central Market, or at the french rooftop bar, Perch for a classic view of DTLA.
- Just a short distance away from Little Tokyo and the Arts District.
- Make downtown your basecamp while you head over to the west side for some sand and surf, only 20 min drive (without traffic) ;-)

name: ★ Open Loft in the Heart of DTLA's Arts District ★
description:
This downtown loft is the perfect way to experience downtown's Arts District. With an open artists loft space, wonderful city views and incredible restaurants, bars and small boutique artists studios you're in the heart and center of what makes this district the beautiful and interesting Arts District. Bonus: This location is also right across the street from the vibrant and culturally amazing downtown district of Little Tokyo !!!

The space
The sofa folds out into a very comfortable full-sized sofa bed , thus allowing the space to sleep 4.

Wifi and Apple TV are included, giving access to Netflix, HBO, Starz, Amazon Prime. Cable TV is provided via the Spectrum TV app on Apple TV.

Guest access
Guests are able to access the enclosed parking lot for 2 reserved parking spaces, the entire home, and the common rooftop jacuzzi and BBQ area (Must wear masks and follow social distancing guidelines while in common areas of building!)
neighborhood_overview: The Arts District is a district within Downtown Los Angeles that is filled with creative street art and murals, huge loft spaces and a chill artsy vibe to all of it's buildings, restaurants and bars. There is a craft style esthetic running throughout the city.
host_about: Hey! I'm a filmmaker who moved to LA from NYC and am loving every minute of it :).  Heading out of town for work and opening up my home like I have in the past!! Look forward to hearing from you.

name: DESIGNER LOFT
description:
Designer Loft ideal for creative professionals. Beautifully lit and private studio in heart of new DTLA in historical district. Walking distance to hip bars and restaurants. Connected to new restaurant Le Petite Paris and El Dorado Bar. 10 min walking distance to Staples Center/Convention Center and 25 min drive to LAX. Washer and dryer inside of unit. Security at front door.

The space
El Dorado building is a historic landmark building. Once a hotel back in the 1910's where the likes of Charlie Chaplin and old Hollywood socialites hung and out lived. The El Dorado Lofts is what had originally been the old Hotel Stowell. When the Hotel Stowell first opened its doors on Spring Street in 1914, the area was rapidly gaining a reputation as “The Wall Street of the West.” The apartment has history and you can feel this history when staying in the space.

Guest access
Guests will be given a FOB to get in the building and up through elevator.
neighborhood_overview: Loft is located in the Historic District walking distance to top rated bars and restaurants in DTLA.

neighborhood_overview:
Read this please!!!
LOCATION is important to you and us as well. We want our guests to make sure they are booking the right place and area for their needs and comfort.
Our area is industrial and gritty, we are surrounded by businesses that are busy in the day but at nighttime it's pretty slow outside. It's not the suburbs, please see above note Industrial and gritty.
Located on the outskirts of the Arts District in Downtown LA (outskirts not inside). There are lots of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums and a grocery store all within walking distance. Not next door or in the same block but a 2-10 minute walk and all of these things exist.
If you are looking to step outside of your door and have action waiting for you this is not the place. Be aware before booking, and please take all of this into consideration. Downtown is a really cool up and coming area of LA with some great history and some of the best restaurants in the City.
MOCA, The Broad, ICA

This live/work unit features 14’ ceilings with wood rafters, hardwood floors and sweeping city skyline views through large pane windows that overlook a recently completed city park.

The space
A newly appointed gourmet kitchen with stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, rolling island and caesar-stone countertops. Huge and modern bathroom with Bosch washer/dryer. Includes a 40” smart TV (YouTube TV and Netflix are included), fast WiFi and the space is a great space to work.

1 car gated garage parking. 24/7 security/concierge with a gorgeous rooftop lounge, pool/spa, with a fitness room and outdoor fire pit.

LOTS OF FUN!

The space

neighborhood_overview:
Read this please!!!
LOCATION is important to you and us as well. We want our guests to make sure they are booking the right place and area for their needs and comfort.
Our area is industrial and gritty, we are surrounded by businesses that are busy in the day but at nighttime it's pretty slow outside. It's not the suburbs, please see above note Industrial and gritty.
Located on the outskirts of the Arts District in Downtown LA (outskirts not inside). There are lots of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums and a grocery store all within walking distance. Not next door or in the same block but a 2-10 minute walk and all of these things exist.
If you are looking to step outside of your door and have action waiting for you this is not the place. Be aware before booking, and please take all of this into consideration. Downtown is a really cool up and coming area of LA with some great history and some of the best restaurants in the City.
MOCA, The Broad, ICA

neighborhood_overview:
DTLA baby! Holy smokes is this bustling. Full restaurants and bars on a Monday night? Yes, indeed. Young, modern, diverse crowd. Bustling with art and activity. Now that Venice is meh, this is where it's happening.

Alright peeps, this here is really important:
A few guests from out of town complained about the number of homeless in DTLA and knocked a star off the location for this listing. With all due respect, but that's Downtown LA and Los Angeles in general. This is one of the largest metros in the world, it's dirty, it's loud, it's Bladerunner.

This particular area is pretty good (Arts District and Fashion District are rougher) and gentrifying rapidly. Luxury condo skyscrapers are rising on every corner, a huge mall/office building is being constructed across the street, Pershing Square Park is undergoing a major redesign, Jewelry District and Broadway are being completely redone. As in Hollywood and Venice (and other parts of LA) this only leads to more

name: Sweet Room at Little Tokyo! Girls Only
description:
The apartment is located in one of the best places in LA, Little Tokyo. It is adjunct to Downtown LA, Art District and Korean Town, very close to highways. Metro, markets and tons of restaurants are within walking distance. You don't need to worry about coming here without a car. The apartment itself is brand new with excellent facilities, including the pool, hot tub, gym, club room and outdoor spaces (we have BBQ, kitchen, and billiards). You'll enjoy living here with other young people.

The space
This is the places only for the girls. The room is bright and sweet decorated. Guests will have your own closet and private bathroom. We have a huge dinner table in the living room and enjoy sitting there having a cup of coffee with friends.

Guest access
You'll have access to the whole apartment except my roommate's room :)

Other things to note
【1】I am listing my own bedroom so I'll only accept girls.

【2】 Sorry,
neighborhood_overview:
Little Tokyo attracts young people. Rarely places in LA are like Little Tokyo, everything you need is within walking distance, restaurants, coffee shop, market, bookstore, museum, art gallery, bars, nightclub, public transportation. You are very close to the newly development Art District and historical DTLA. You'll even walk to some famous attractions such as Moma museum, Japanese Village Plaza, The Broad museum, OUE Skyspace, Union Station, Chinatown, Grand Central Market, and famous restaurants like JiST Cafe, Blacktop Coffee, Shin-Sen-Gumi Raman, Daikokuya Raman and Marugame Monzo Udon, the Spring french restaurant. Starbucks is just at the entrance of the building.

Several events are held in this area. We've seen parades, biking events, Japanese culture exhibitions. Though there is a lot going on in this area, it is very nice and quiet at night.

What I like Little Tokyo most is that it is "walk friendly", which is very rare in LA. I used to live in Korean

name: Angel City Loft with Urban Retro Design & Views of Downtown — City Registered
description:
Due to increased fraud, Reserver must be verified with Airbnb first AND then upload a copy of their government ID to host within 12 hrs of booking or RESERVATION WILL BE CANCELED. Please make sure you understand Airbnb Covid & NO PARTY policies and our House Rules. TY!


Come enjoy the beautiful views while relaxing in this 10th floor 1920s Beaux-Arts loft located in the Historic Core. The industrial past of this renovated space is still apparent in its high ceilings and polished concrete floors. Unique unit with 7 large windows and personal balcony. Registered with City of LA HSR19-003590.

License number
HSR19-003590
neighborhood_overview:
Historic Core is conveniently within walking distance to numerous stores, sites, restaurants, & venues.

Please research the Historic Core before coming to ensure you are comfortable with the area! If neighborhood cleanliness, peacefulness, and safety is a top concern of yours, do not stay here! Numerous homeless people; be aware of your surroundings. Pershing Square across the street is a hub for many protests and events. Plan accordingly.
host_about:
I am an artist, musician, and writer. I am married and have 2 teenage sons. This property serves as a second home when my husband or I need to be closer to work. When we aren’t here, we’re excited to share the place with you! 

I was lucky as a child to travel a little bit, and now I try to carry on the tradition of bringing our family to new places filled with adventures and great experiences. A busy life in California doesn't leave us a lot of time for vacation, but we make the most of it with local camping trips, and visits to see family members in San Francisco and Kona, HI. We've recently traveled to Germany, France, England, Mexico, Amsterdam, and Japan. 

My favorite things about traveling are seeing architecture, eating the food, and meeting people. We don't need extravagant accommodations to have an amazing time, and being creative professionals, we often enjoy the quirky and absurd side of things! Life is short; it should be enjoyed thoroughly.
