name: Spacious DTLA one bedroom loft with a view
description:
Spacious and airy DTLA loft apartment in the middle of all the action but perched above it on the quiet 12th floor with a gorgeous skyline view.

Large one bedroom with a comfy king size bed and all the amenities of home (it's my home, after all). Fully equipped with everything you need and truly comfortable.

Located in a gorgeous building in the vibrant historic center of downtown LA, with amazing restaurants just beneath you. Just steps away from the metro and all the action in DTLA.

The space
Please feel free to contact me, I'm happy to answer any queries you might have about the space.

This isn't the usual cheap furniture bare-bones Airbnb apartment- it's a real home, with nice fluffy towels, soft bedding with plenty of pillows, and all the comforts of home!

1100 SF apartment (it's huge!) on the 12th floor, not street facing so it's very quiet (a rarity downtown) and the large windows have a gorgeous skyline view.
neighborhood_overview:
Right in the middle of everything! Some of Los Angeles' best restaurants and nightlife are within a couple blocks, and you're just two blocks from the Pershing Square metro station- 15 min to get to Hollywood. Easy to get anywhere in LA.
Check out my Guidebook section, I put some of my favorite local spots!

name: Downtown Los Angeles Dream
description:
Beautiful, light drenched loft in the heart of downtown. Enjoy the rooftop pool with stunning views of the Los Angeles skyline, and even the Hollywood sign! Wake up and look out over the city as you enjoy a morning coffee from the artisanal balcony swing. Walking distance to many of LA’s best restaurants, interesting shops, fun bars, and Little Tokyo/the Arts District.

The space
Please feel free to use the rooftop pool. There is also quarter fed laundry in the basement. My apartment is filled with cooking appliances and gadgets to service your every culinary need!

I do live in the loft when it is not being rented so please note that there are personal belongings around the unit - this is not a typical rental, but has the charm of coming to stay with one of your best friends! There is also a small french bulldog named Bowser who lives here when it is not being rented, so if you have a severe dog allergy, this might not be the place for you.

Read this please!!!
LOCATION is important to you and us as well. We want our guests to make sure they are booking the right place and area for their needs and comfort.
Our area is industrial and gritty, we are surrounded by businesses that are busy in the day but at nighttime it's pretty slow outside. It's not the suburbs, please see above note Industrial and gritty.
Located on the outskirts of the Arts District in Downtown LA (outskirts not inside). There are lots of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums and a grocery store all within walking distance. Not next door or in the same block but a 2-10 minute walk and all of these things exist.
If you are looking to step outside of your door and have action waiting for you this is not the place. Be aware before booking, and please take all of this into consideration. Downtown is a really cool up and coming area of LA with some great history and some of the best restaurants in the City.

name: In the City of Angels - Elvis Tiki Room w/Jacuzzi!
description:
Monthly Stay @$38 per night! 100% Transit Score
98% Walk Score - Walk to Whole Foods and 7th Metro Subway Station.

FREE WiFi @ 300Mpbs

Best DTLA room price w/door, lock & key.

The Elvis Presley Tiki Loft features memorabilia of his fondness for Hawaii, full mattress, closet, desk & chair. Share kitchen, bathroom, living area with guests.

NO FREE PARKING

A tiny room. Sound can be an issue due to loft walls & central air.

THIS ROOM IS CHEAP FOR A REASON! READ EVERYTHING BEFORE BOOKING!

The space
This is a Loft Space. By definition, the Airbnb loft category feature some walls that don’t go all the way up to the ceiling. Sound can be a factor, including the central air which is located in this room and is quite loud, so light sleepers should come prepared. Look at the last image in the photo library to see the 8 foot walls and gap at the ceiling.

This entire space rates 4.7 Stars
neighborhood_overview:
Make no mistake about DTLA, it is an exciting city full of life but... Homelessness is a fact of life here. Whether you stay in our building, a hotel, or anywhere in downtown Los Angeles, they will be noticed. Our building is a vintage, less sound-proofed artist loft. We have mostly 5 star ratings, but there are a few guests who don't quite understand what it means to reside in the heart of a big city like DTLA! Those of us who choose to live here, absolutely love it! Within our immediate 2 blocks we are surrounded by quality bars and restaurants, the historical theatre district, and even a Whole Foods grocery store 5 minutes away.

Come and enjoy it with us!

The BEST DEAL in the Historic Core of Downtown Los Angeles! Located a few blocks from the Metro Subway, Fashion District, and next door to restaurants, pubs & clubs! 2-3 blocks from The Regent Theater, Tower, Orpheum and Los Angeles Theater! Walk to; WHOLE FOODS, ACE HOTEL, THE STANDARD, SHERATON, MILLENNIUM
host_about: An award winning film maker who spent 30 years writing, producing and directing in Hawaii. Returned to Los Angeles for my mom. Wrote a novel and screenplay titled "In the City of Angels" a dark tale of redemption. This was inspired by directing a dozen mini documentaries in Skid Row while also walking 2,000 miles a year across the city of Los Angeles. I really do love DTLA! The Heart of Downtown Los Angeles.

neighborhood_overview:
Formerly the city center before World War II, Downtown LA's Historic Core is rich with architectural treasures - including the largest concentration of historic theatres in the world and beloved pre-1930s buildings in Beaux Arts, Art Deco, and Spanish Baroque styles. Visit the renovated theaters on Broadway, or the famous cage elevators and detailed ironwork at the Bradbury Building across the street from the famous Grand Central Market.

Walking distance or short trip to:
Arts District
Bunker Hill & Grand Avenue
Chinatown
Civic Center
Fashion District
Figueroa Corridor
Flower District
Gallery Row
Historic Downtown
Jewelry District
Little Tokyo
Olvera Street at Historic El Pueblo
South Park
Wholesale District
host_about:
Born and raised in Orange County, California, living in Downtown Los Angeles. I've lived in Downtown Los Angeles' Historic Core for almost three years.

Living in Downtown Los Angeles allows me to explore various communities throughout Los Angeles and discovering cafes, eateries, restaurants, museums, and outdoor activities.

Hospitality has been a part of my upbringing. I enjoy connecting with new people, making them feel welcome by entertaining and recommending places locals frequent throughout the city.

description:
Beautiful, very well appointed, loft-style apartment inside an historic building in Downtown Los Angeles. High ceilings, exposed brick, huge windows, lots of light and a great view. Rooftop pool, hot tub and a small gym are all available for guest use. Centrally located in the Historic Core with many of LA’s best restaurants and bars within walking distance or a very short ride away.

The space
The sleeping area features a King-sized bed (with incredibly comfortable “Leesa” mattress) along with a 50” TV and Apple TV. Wardrobe (for hanging items), dresser drawers and nightstands available for guest use.

A very comfortable queen-sized air mattress is also available for use if needed.

neighborhood_overview: This is the most walkable neighborhood in Los Angeles with a huge number of the city’s best bars, restaurants, museums, theaters and venues are located within a short walk. Little Tokyo and the Arts District are also within a mile walk/Lyft/Uber. For groceries there are multiple bodegas within a couple blocks and Whole Foods is less than a 10 min walk away. For beer/liquor/wine: Jason’s is a great liquor store and Buzz has a huge selection of beer/wine. Both are two blocks away.

neighborhood_overview: Downtown Los Angeles’ Historic Core is the hippest area in LA. Home to world class shopping destinations like Aesop, Acne, Mykita, Urban Outfitters, Little Monster, APC, Apple and just a quick walk from Target, Zara, H&M, Macy’s. Grab groceries and lunch at Whole Foods. Impress your boss with a dinner at Joey DTLA or Bottega Louie. Eat the best sushi hand rolls at the ultra modern and melt-in-your-mouth delicious Kazu Nori. Grab pho at Blossom, “cheese tea” at Little Fluffy Head, and black ice cream at the Instagram favorite Little Damage. You'll often see a Hollywood movie being shot around the corner, or models posing for photos on neighboring rooftops. Craft is king around here. Beers on tap at Spring Street Bar are a favorite and cocktails at the hidden and hard to find Varnish are award winning. Between Verve coffee and G&B, it’s tough to decide whose pour over is more delicious. See world class musicians at Exchange around the corner or Regent a few blocks away or take in a Laker
host_about: I'm from Los Angeles, I'm an interior designer, and love to eat at restaurants and explore the city!!

- It's an old 1910 building. Although we clean daily & paint often, it's easy to THINK things are dirty, especially the floors

- We ask a lot of questions before approving you

The space

While it's not fancy, if you are looking for a basic simple, inexpensive place to stay in an excellent location, a
neighborhood_overview: Little Tokyo is the most vibrant area of downtown Los Angeles, with authentic Japanese eateries, markets, and stores.  Don't miss Sushi Gen for sushi or Daikokuya for ramen.  The Arts District is nearby as well, with plenty of cafes, art galleries, and street art to view, as well as some of the best restaurants in LA.  Favorites include Bestia and Manuela, and Salt & Straw for ice cream.

name: Spacious Downtown 1BR w/ Doorman, nr. Disney Hall by Blueground
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cheery Downtown furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and charming living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Los Angeles has to offer! (#LAX33)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Los Angeles vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- 24/7 Security
neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

It is difficult to come up with unique language to describe one of the most iconic art-deco buildings in the United States. We like this from Curbed LA…“[T]his freaking fantastic Claud-Beelman-designed Art Deco building stands out even in Downtown, where there are plenty of very lovely restored buildings around. The building's exterior is covered in striking teal terra cotta and has all sorts of fun embellishments (golden chevrons, sunbursts), all topped off by a clock tower and neon "Eastern" sign. Now holding fancy lofts and equally fancy ground-floor retail, it's part of the rapidly-fancifying section of Broadway near the Ace Hotel”

description:
Discover the best of Los Angeles, with this one-bedroom Downtown apartment with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this beautifully Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, comfortable living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#LAX1)

The space
Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your pretty living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this Downtown apartment has to offer. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Just in 10 mins you can be in Arts District, where true artist spirit of LA still reigns but in 30 mins you can travel to Beverly Hills and have a much more refined time as well. Downtown LA offers you all.

The space
This is a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment.

Master bedroom features a walk-in closet, while the other room features a built-in wardrobe as well.

In the living room, you will have a 65' Smart TV, with Netflix, HBO and Amazon Prime connections.

neighborhood_overview:
Downtown LA is perhaps the most exciting area within LA right now. Most of city's best restaurants are here with new ones opening up every other week. It is by far the most walkable district in the city, by taking a 10 min walk you can drob by three different cocktail bars and on your way back you can check out a museum, then attend a concert. It is the place to be.

Just in the downstairs plaza you are able to visit MOCA (Museum of Contemporary Arts) Downtown Branch and across the road you can visit The Broad (a museum that exhibits Broad Family's very own items). By taking a 5 minute walk, you can go to US Bank Tower, where on viewing deck you will be given a short course on LA's history, and after that you can see LA from it's highest building with every landmark unfolded below you.

name: Quiet Design Loft in Downtown LA, w/ Pool on Roof!
description:
A cozy travelers loft nestled in Downtown LA. Windows face the inside of the building to escape from the chaos of downtown, it feels like you are in a quiet sanctuary. Make yourself at home with a full kitchen, two full bathrooms, and a living space for good conversation, browse through the books and enjoy this cozy space. Pool on the roof to relax. - Close to everything downtown has to offer, and you are able to walk which is rare for LA. Easy 5 minute drive to the arts district.

The space
Please use the clothing rack or empty drawers under the bed for your clothing so you feel at home. Dishwasher which is a perk, and an all-in-one washer and dryer in case you need a quick wash. Also larger laundry machines available in the basement. The pool on the roof has great views of downtown and is open daily till 10pm. It it’s shared with the rest of the building.
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown is "up and coming" there are TONS of new restaurants and shops opening all the time. Can give a few suggestions as well. Wander through grand central market on broadway to get a little taste of everything. Arts district is an easy commute in an uber/lyft.
Close to little tokyo as well. There are great bars and restaurants and shopping all around downtown. Happy to give suggestions depending on your needs. My favorite restaurants are Baco Mercat, Kazu Nori, or Bar Ama. Be sure to walk through Grand Central Market as well. And just across the street is the beautiful Bradbury Building, peek inside, its quite a grand lobby, was in many movies.

neighborhood_overview:
Downtown LA contains many diverse neighborhoods, each with their own personality and community. From premier sushi in Little Tokyo, to a free concert in Pershing Square, to stimulating exhibits.

Fashion District
The LA Fashion District is the hub of the apparel industry on the West Coast, where shoppers, designers, stylists, students, retailers, wholesale buyers, and residents all converge. You'll find apparel and accessories for the entire family, textiles, flowers, and more.

Arts District
This formerly industrial area was transformed into an artist community in the mid-70's. Today, the Arts District thrives with galleries, photography studios, graphic artists, small advertising firms, video and media companies, and the Southern California Institute of Architecture (SCI-ARC).


Figueroa Corridor
Best known for the University of Southern California, LA Memorial Coliseum, Exposition Park, and the Shrine Auditorium, the Figueroa Corrido

description:
Hello! This loft is located in the heart of Downtown LA, on historic Spring Street. This particular street and area is very clean and nice, with lots of surrounding restaurants, bars, and places to get a cup of Joe. We have a parking garage adjacent to the building so you don't have to find parking. This loft is on the top floor of the building with amazing views, especially at night. It can accommodate up to 2 people or 2 couples. Come and enjoy the ideal Downtown LA experience!

The space
We have 2 beds and 1 bathroom. So we can accommodate 2 single people or 2 couples. Unless you have an extra person who wants to crash on the couch is pretty large. There is a Brand new 50 inch Smart TV. You can watch Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, etc...

Exempt - This listing is a transient occupancy residential structure
neighborhood_overview:
This particular street is a historic street. So it's just nice to walk around in. There is a park next door, that allows dogs if you want just hangout around some nature. The rest of the area is packed with restaurants and bars. Just two blocks away is the Grand Central Market. This area is a whole block with just restraunts/bars and food vendors. They have basically everything you can imagine food wise. You name it, They got it.

We have security on the block, it's quite safe to be in. Which is really really nice since Downtown LA can be somewhat crazy sometimes. We have a Cafe right next door to us called Le Petit Paris. So you can always grab a coffee and pastry there. I also provide coffee makers (With Pods) in the rooms as well.

This is a very special area. There is some of the best spots in the city just steps away.

Want one of the best hand rolled sushi or taco spots? You got it. Kazu Nori is blocks away as well as Sonoratown (tacos). TRUST ME, you will not be let down.

Want a killer rooftop with a pool and bar service? You bet. Freehand Hotel has the infamous Broken Shaker and a beautiful pool. Ace Hotel has the tunes and views. Perch, Nomad and Standard are also very close by.

If you want a great cafe, visit my pals over at ilCaffe in the historic Eastern Building. They even have small bites and a lovely outside seating. Even closer is Verve Cafe with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating and a great work flow environment.

Grand Central Market is filled with restaurants in an open air arcade that walks directly to the "world shortest train line" which takes you up and near The Broad, MOCA and Walt Disney Music Hall, on Grand.

name: Bright and Vibrant Downtown LA Loft
description:
Bright and vibrant Downtown LA Loft located in the Fashion District.

The space
You will love the all the light in this open concept studio loft in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles' Fashion District. The space is perfect for a couple's weekend getaway trip or for a longer term business traveler looking for the comforts and necessities of home while on the road.

The space has 1 queen bed and a queen air mattress located in the bedroom closet. The couch is also very comfortable and can sleep an additional guest. The kitchen contains all utensils, plates, glasses, pots/pans if you are looking to have a night in and cook a nice meal during your stay. Free WIFI and Apple TV with access to Hulu and Amazon Prime.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to the LA Fashion District, the hub of the Los Angeles Fashion Industry. We have 100 blocks of independently owned retail and wholesale businesses with apparel, accessories, footwear, beauty and cosmetics for the entire family. The district is also home to The LA Flower District – including the LA Flower Market, the largest flower market in the USA, and the California Flower Mall; Santee Alley – the famed downtown open air bazaar; and the LA Fabric District – with the largest selection of fabrics and notions in Southern California.

host_about:
We built Zeus Living so you can feel at home wherever opportunity takes you. Whether it’s for a month, a year, or sometime in between, you can count on a thoughtfully designed home and a comfortable, easy stay. Our technology helps us select homes you’ll love in ideal locations at a good value, while our expert team handles all the details. Based in San Francisco, and operating in the Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Boston, and Washington, D.C.


** 
PLEASE NOTE: Many of our homes are pet friendly, which you will see listed under "House Rules". If you do plan to bring your furry friend(s), we have a one-time non-refundable $500 pet fee and have a limit of 2 pets max. We have several dog breed restrictions. Most of our dog-friendly homes do not allow American Pit bulls, Rottweilers, Akitas, Cane Corsos, Presa Canarios, Bull Mastiffs, Staffordshire Terriers, Dobermans, German Shepherds, Boxers, Malamutes, Huskies, Dalmatians, Chow Chows, Fila Brasileiros, or Wolf hybrids. We encourage individuals with service animals or one of the breeds listed as restricted to contact us before booking.

name: CLEAN and Spacious DTLA Urban Loft
description:
This spacious 940 sq ft loft is on the 8th floor within the fashion district and right next to the flower mart. Also, just 2 blocks away from Spring Street. Located less than a block away from the infamous Sonoratown Tacos, Stumptown Coffee, Escape Room, and Avenue des Arts Gallery there are plenty of activities and places to eat. Unlike most downtown industrial converted lofts, this space comes with completely remodeled interior for a nice luxurious & clean feel with an enormous walk-in closet.

The space
This loft is located 2 blocks away from Spring Street, where most of the bars and clubs are. It's the perfect distance away from the loud Spring Street patrons at night, while being easily accessible by a 5 min walk.

Other things to note
Bathroom is fully remodeled, modern minimalistic style.
neighborhood_overview: Stumptown Coffee, Sonoratown Tacos (netfilx), Escape Room, Avenue des Arts art gallery, Terroni, Broken Mouth, Braazo Pizza, Shake Shack, plenty of bars and clubs within 5-10 min walk.

name: Luxury 2 Bedroom Smart Loft
description:
Gorgeous luxury 800 sf loft that is recently renovated with modern french decor. The grandeur of this 2 bedroom loft compares with no other property. 10 foot ceilings that rarely exists. Designed and decorated with top of the line finishes, Alexa enabled Smart Home, and furniture. Located in LA's most popular neighborhoods. The Wilshire Grand Center is a 1,100-foot skyscraper in clear sight from the building's private rooftop will leave you in awe. Public transportation is at your doorstep.

The space
This is DTLA like you never have seen it. Enjoy the building's private rooftop and watch the city as it sparkles alive at night. Lights on the rooftop sparkle at night and it’s amazing to watch the sun sets. The city is bathed in warm shades of pink sunsets. The Eastern Building is so close you feel like you can reach out and touch it. Enjoy LA in the center of it all and most days filming and casting is at every corner. You’ll be walking into 500 square feet open
neighborhood_overview:
You are literally walking distances to Downtown LA's Stunning Spire 73 which is America's Tallest Open-Air Bar and local favorites:

"Downtown Los Angeles has an authentic cultural buzz you won’t find in any other city. It’s a vibrant mix of old and new which has blended together to create something unique. Downtown LA is a part of the city where skyscrapers rub shoulders with historical buildings and museums share street addresses with movie theaters".

Less than a mile away from the best attractions in Downtown LA, spacious concrete and loft style design gives this apartment a very exclusive downtown LA vibe! Great view from rooftop pool as you enjoy a swim or work out in our gym.

-24Hr Security Guard at Front Desk!

Studio located in between Maine/Spring st.

-WALKING SCORE of 97!
- My place is great for couples, solo adventurers and business.

The space
Modern luxury and extremely comfortable studio loft in Popular core location of DTLA. Modern and comfortable furnishing accommodate up to 4. Close to many Downtown LA attractions with some of the best roof top lounges, bars, and restaurants walking distance away. Ideal space for travelers as well as locals looking to get away for a weekend and experience Los Angeles.

The space

You’re welcome to anything in the fridge! :) Catch the breathtaking views from the balcony! There’s so much to see here!!

Gas cooking range and convection oven give you endless chef ability.

Apple 4K TV, 55 In flat screen TV, Super Fast WiFi

Cozy bed with luxury linen.

name: The quintessential downtown loft
description:
With unobstructed Southern & Eastern views this loft is flooded with natural light from sunrise to sunset. Through a double door entrance you find yourself in this 860 square foot 1 bedroom, 1 bath, 11 floor corner unit. In the style of industrial chic the brick walls have been exposed, polished concrete floors, 10 foot ceilings and best of all 4 oversized windows that look out over Spring & 7th Street. The bedroom is separated by a steel and glass, french door walls. Ready for enjoyment!

The space
In addition to the loft space, there is a large rooftop with rooftop furniture. The views from the rooftop are sweeping and offer 360 degree city views, spectacular by day and by night.

Other things to note
Smoking is not allowed in the unit.
neighborhood_overview:

name: Arts District Private Room 222
description:
Best value in most exciting part of DTLA! Walk to Arts District, Little Tokyo, Gold Line. Near public transport, great restaurants & shopping. Private rooms with shared bath and kitchen cleaned daily. Friendly international vibe!

Interested guests must be fully verified with clear profile photo. Message host with full name, age, detailed reason for visit, employer, university affiliation, and confirmation that you have read full description and reviews of unit.

The space
Live in in the heart of Little Tokyo and the Arts District with other international travelers, visitors, and residents! Sogo Residence is a historic brick building that has served Los Angeles travelers for over 100 years. Rooms are SRO dormitory-style: rooms are locked and private but bathroom and kitchens are shared.

While it's not fancy, if you are looking for a basic simple, inexpensive place to stay in an excellent location, and are comfortable living in an older h
neighborhood_overview: Little Tokyo is the most vibrant area of downtown Los Angeles, with authentic Japanese eateries, markets, and stores.  Don't miss Sushi Gen for sushi or Daikokuya for ramen.  The Arts District is nearby as well, with plenty of cafes, art galleries, and street art to view, as well as some of the best restaurants in LA.  Favorites include Bestia and Manuela, and Salt & Straw for ice cream.

name: In the City of Angels - City Room w/Jacuzzi & Gym!
description:
Great space In the City of Angels, Downtown Los Angeles! 98 Walk Score + 100 Transit Score. Half mile to Subway Station, Walk to Whole Foods & Ralphs Supermarket. FREE WiFi @ 300Mpbs

Loft room with access to rooftop pool, jacuzzi & gym! Share living/dining area, full kitchen & bathroom.

Best DTLA room rental w/rooftop pool, jacuzzi and gym.

Your door locks with your set of keys. 24 Hour Security!

Disclaimer: Loft Rooms have sound issues, not ideal for light sleepers. No free parking.

The space
This is a private "Loft" Room. By definition, the Airbnb loft category are places with walls that don’t go all the way up to the ceiling. Sound can be a factor so light sleepers should come prepared. However, with over 900 guest reviews, this entire space awarded Jon’s Place with the prestigious SuperHost status by averaging over 4.7 Stars out of 5! Why? Because we are absolutely the best deal in DTLA! Come enjoy and save a
neighborhood_overview:
Make no mistake about DTLA, it is an exciting city full of life but... Homelessness is a fact of life here. Whether you stay in our building, a hotel, or anywhere in downtown Los Angeles, they will be noticed. Our building is a vintage, less sound-proofed artist loft. We have mostly 5 star ratings, but there are a few guests who don't quite understand what it means to reside in the heart of a big city like DTLA! Those of us who choose to live here, absolutely love it! Within our immediate 2 blocks we are surrounded by quality bars and restaurants, the historical theatre district, and even a Whole Foods grocery store 5 minutes away.

Come and enjoy it with us!

LOCATED ON 7TH & SPRING - Walk to 7th St. Metro Subway Station; ride to Hollywood Walk of Fame, Universal Studio & Santa Monica Beach. Walk to Staples Center, LA Convention Center, LA Live, Westin, ACE & JW Marriott.

24 HOUR SECURITY & DOORMAN.
host_about: An award winning film maker who spent 30 years writing, producing and directing in Hawaii. Returned to Los Angeles for my mom. Wrote a novel and screenplay titled "In the City of Angels" a dark tale of redemption. This was inspired by directing a dozen mini documentaries in Skid Row while also walking 2,000 miles a year across the city of Los Angeles. I really do love DTLA! The Heart of Downtown Los Angeles.

neighborhood_overview: Location is near Pershing Square, Grand Central Market, L. A Live, Staple Center, Regal Cinema, Little Tokyo and many bars and restaurants. Location is also conveniently, located near the metro station and there is no trouble getting a Uber, or lift. Ride north to Hollywood, west to Santa Monica, south to Long Beach, or east to visit the up and coming gentrification city of Boyle Heights. Don’t feel like going out? Not a problem, stay in and enjoy the pool on the roof top.

name: In the City of Angels - DTLA Room w/attached bath
description:
In the City of Angels, Downtown Los Angeles, Loft Room includes your own attached full private bathroom. DTLA 98 Walk Score + 100 Transit Score. Walk to Whole Foods and Ralphs Supermarket! 1/2m to Metro Subway Station

Best DTLA room rent w/rooftop pool, jacuzzi and gym!

Your door locks with your set of keys. Share living/dining & full kitchen!

FREE WiFi @ 300Mpbs
24 Hour Security Doorman.

Disclaimer: Loft Rooms are not for light sleepers. No free parking.

The space
This is a private "Loft" Room. By definition, the Airbnb loft category are places with walls that don’t go all the way up to the ceiling. Sound can be a factor so light sleepers should come prepared. However, with over 900 guest reviews, this entire space often awarded Jon’s Place with the prestigious SuperHost status by averaging over 4.7 to 4.8 Stars out of 5! Why? Because we are absolutely the best deal in DTLA!

24 HOUR SECURITY & DOORMA
neighborhood_overview:
This is the best monthly rental deal in Downtown Los Angeles. Especially, one with a rooftop pool, jacuzzi and gym.

Walking distance to Whole Foods and Ralph’s supermarkets.

Perfect for walking to work in the Fashion District.

Working in any of the arts buildings and theaters on Grand Avenue.

USC is just 4 miles away with both the Subway and Dash bus at your ready.

An architect, a jeweler or a banker, all walking districts.

The local business DASH bus is right outside our door, for 50 cents it will take you everywhere local including the 7th Street Metro Subway station. And, if you use the TAP card on the DASH, the card will provide a FREE transfer on any Metro bus or subway.

The Subway will take you to Hollywood, Universal Studios and 2 blocks away from the Santa Monica Beach!

Make no mistake about DTLA, it is an exciting city full of life but... Homelessness is a fact of life here. Whether you st
host_about: An award winning film maker who spent 30 years writing, producing and directing in Hawaii. Returned to Los Angeles for my mom. Wrote a novel and screenplay titled "In the City of Angels" a dark tale of redemption. This was inspired by directing a dozen mini documentaries in Skid Row while also walking 2,000 miles a year across the city of Los Angeles. I really do love DTLA! The Heart of Downtown Los Angeles.

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this charming Downtown furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and cozy living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Los Angeles has to offer! (#LAX204)

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Los Angeles, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- 24/7 Se
neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Stunning one bedroom, one bathroom apartment in Downtown LA with room for 3 guests. The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Los Angeles, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: Downtown Los Angeles (DTLA) offers world class attractions, incredible restaurants, a thriving nightlife and walkable streets. STAPLES Center is home to the Lakers, Clippers, Kings and Sparks, and also hosts major concerts. The spectacular L.A. LIVE entertainment complex includes popular attractions such as the GRAMMY Museum, Lucky Strike Lanes and Regal Cinemas. Conveniently located to the LA Convention Center, Orpheum Theater and the Fashion District. The stunning Walt Disney Concert Hall anchors the Music Center, Dorothy Chandler Pavilion, Ahmanson Theatre and Mark Taper Forum. The Museum of Contemporary Art houses an acclaimed permanent collection and rotating exhibits. Historic Exposition Park is home to the California Science Center, the California African American Museum, the LA Memorial Coliseum and Sports Arena, and the Natural History Museum.

Discover the best of Los Angeles, with this studio Downtown apartment with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this stylishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#LAX279)

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this studio apartment. Ideally located in Los Angeles, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

A unique oasis of 7,000 sq. ft. in iconic downtown Los Angeles Fashion District. Accommodate many or one in our beautiful space. A 40ft quartz (stone) bar, full commercial kitchen, photo/video studio, theater, conference room, offices, pantry,
electronic storage, 3 bathrooms including a full master bathroom suite with shower and infrared sauna and aquaponics garden to power the kitchen with fresh vegetables.
neighborhood_overview: Located in the Fashion District/Flower Market area in historic Downtown Los Angeles (or simply DTLA) offers big-city excitement with trendy restaurants, cultural attractions, budget-friendly shopping, and major-league sports. Easily accessible by Metro and perhaps one of the most pedestrian-friendly urban neighborhoods in Los Angeles, DTLA is being transformed by a multitude of cultural offerings such as regular art walks and street festivals, as well as innovative businesses that include indoor/outdoor markets, hip boutiques, and pop-ups. An influx of new residents has helped energize the area, and Downtown L.A.’s re-emergence is also being driven by such attractions as Grand Park, an urban oasis with views stretching from the Music Center (including Walt Disney Concert Hall) to City Hall.

** THIS LOFT HAS A 90 NIGHT MINIMUM**

name: Downtown Los Angeles Top Floor Condo with a View!
description:
Beautiful, bright, comfortable DTLA condo in located in ideal and central location.

The unit is well lit, spacious, inviting, and comfortable. The kitchen has all the cooking utensils you will need and includes a Nespresso machine, frother, Magic Bullet, and tea kettle. The bed is comfortable and provides a good night's sleep. Strong WiFi connection, smart TV and Sono's.

Inviting balcony perfect for sitting out in the sun.

24-hour security and doorman.

The space
Location is well-lit, good views, clean, fully loaded with all you need, great location, and 24 hour security.

Guest access
Guests will be able to access the entire space.

Other things to note
Due to COVID-19, use of gym and pool may be impacted.
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Los Angeles (DTLA) is located in the heart of Los Angeles and a short 15 minute drive to Hollywood, the beach, and other vital areas in Los Angeles.

DTLA itself is a hip and vibrant neighborhood with lots of new restaurants and bars, a large sports arena, and is home to many key districts in Los Angeles (the financial district, the arts district, the theatre district, the fashion district, the flower district, the brewery district etc.).

The unit itself is in a prime location within DTLA's South Park neighborhood. It is clean and modern. Within a block you will find a Whole Foods, Ralph's, Macy's, Target, Starbucks Coffee, Zara, Nordstrom Rack, Lululemon, WeWork, athletic gyms and yoga studios, and several lively bars and restaurants.

While parking can be included with the unit, the building is a block away from a LA Metro station, bus stops, and there are plenty of e-scooters and bicycles parked outside the building.

Level’s Downtown Los Angeles suites are the personal sanctuary that you’ve been looking for! Your modern suite is more than luxurious and spacious; they are meticulously cleaned with the highest standards for your peace of mind. We are proud to announce that the cleanliness of our suites have rightfully secured LEVEL the GBAC STAR™ facility accreditation. A daily destination amenity fee of $28 plus the City Hotel Tax of 15.5% will be added per room, per day up to a maximum of 30 days.

The space
These executive suites offered by Level are sophisticated in every which way. Embrace your inner epicurean in our fully-equipped gourmet kitchen. There is no shortage of entertainment when you're visiting the City of Angels. In fact, the majority of events held in Los Angeles happen right here in Downtown.

SoulCycle

name: In the City of Angels - Premium Loft to Yourself!
description:
We put a lot of love into this Parisian style loft located in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles. The perfect place to relax or work from home. 680 Sq Ft Loft Studio/1BA with full kitchen, washer/dryer & amazing DTLA views.
Located in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles. Walking distance to everything!

100 Transit Score / FREE WiFi @300Mpbs
Walk to Whole Foods, Ralphs, CVS, Metro Subway

The space
My space is a nicely decorated loft with charming touches. Staying here will feel like staying at a luxury hotel without the insane room rates and fees!

Guest access
You have access to the rooftop pool/hot tub and gym.

Other things to note
ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING! Guests have broken this rule and there will be a large fee if this rule is broken. Please read the house manual!!!!
neighborhood_overview: Our loft is within 1 mile or less of the Convention Center and the Staples Center.  We are also close to USC and FIDM. We are about 20-30 min from LAX depending on traffic. We are in the prime location for bars & restaurants known as the Historic Core that attracts a lot of creatives. We are in Downtown Los Angeles so like all major cities in America there is noise and homeless people nearby.   Please don't hesitate to ask any questions!
host_about: An award winning film maker who spent 30 years writing, producing and directing in Hawaii. Returned to Los Angeles for my mom. Wrote a novel and screenplay titled "In the City of Angels" a dark tale of redemption. This was inspired by directing a dozen mini documentaries in Skid Row while also walking 2,000 miles a year across the city of Los Angeles. I really do love DTLA! The Heart of Downtown Los Angeles.

name: Modern Artist Loft DTLA
description:
Experience the colorful life of Los Angeles in this large contemporary artist loft in the heart of the city. Relax in or head out for a night on the town. This gorgeous loft has exposed brick walls and a 30’ brick ceiling with plenty of greenery. It is well decorated full of modern classic pieces. It has a flat screen TV, surround sound, full kitchen, 2 baths, AC. and a rooftop pool and jacuzzi with a view of the skyline. It is located in DTLA near bars, restaurants, shops, museums or the beach.

The space
Gorgeous space with 30’ vaulted ceilings, exposed brick, plenty of plants and contemporary interior design. It comes with a full kitchen, TV, surround sound, AC, 2 bathrooms, a bathtub, an outdoor balcony, a rooftop with a view of the skyline and easy access to the city.

Guest access
All

host_location: Los Angeles County, California, United States
host_about: Always trying to X off the next line item on my bucket list, you can also catch me: bombing hills on my skateboard, drinking frothy brews, galavanting the social scene, and roaming the outdoors. I love arts, photography, & music. I am a graphic designer by profession. I developed a deep passion for travel and worldly experience—which I consider my personal pursuit of happiness.

name: Apt 31 Newly remodeled In The Heart DT South Park.
description:
Why Stay At A Hotel! Stay With Us! My place used to be a Hotel! It is close to Bars and Restaurants at LA LIVE, DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES. You’ll love my place because of The walking distance to Los Angles Convention Center and STAPLE CENTER. The comfy bed, the coziness, the kitchen. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

The space
See What Other Guests say:

“The following night (Feb 3rd) we stayed at the double tree downtown, near little Tokyo. It was lovely, but the room was no where near as clean and inviting as your space. In the future I'd love to stay again if attending staples center. And that $7 parking garage was a huge steal. I'm used to paying like $55 overnight in SF.”

Other things to note
Enjoy your day at the restaurants of LA LIVE just a short walk away. Also the night life is great in Downtown Los Angeles. Or get your ticket for a game at STAPLE CENTER less than 10 minutes walk.

name: Spacious Master Bedroom in Downtown LA
description:
Spacious master bedroom with an en suite bathroom. The room has a cozy sitting area and desk. Perfect for business travelers and individuals looking to experience living in the heart of downtown LA.

The space
It's a 1 bedroom apartment. I occupy the living room area that has been sectioned off. There's a full bathroom in the master bedroom and a half bath in the common area. I primarily use the half bath, only using the master bathroom to shower in the mornings. There's a lot of natural light and a lock on the door for additional privacy.

SPACE INCLUDES:
Queen-sized bed
Sofa and desk
Closet space
Fresh towels and linens
Kitchen with everything you need to prepare meals
Wi-Fi
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Downtown Living!

The neighborhood is urban with people from various backgrounds and walks of life. Please keep that in mind.

Conveniently located in downtown Los Angeles, you will encounter sounds of the city: Cars, Fire Engines, people, etc.

The apartment is located within walking distance (10-15 minutes) from train lines: red, blue, expo. Also conveniently located on the bus lines with bike racks and scooters all around.

neighborhood_overview: Downtown Los Angeles has an authentic cultural buzz you won’t find in any other city. It’s a vibrant mix of old and new which has blended together to create something unique. You never know what you’re going to find around the corner or on the next block. It could be a rooftop bar and restaurant, a colorful mural covering the side of a building, or a museum celebrating American music. There are some amazing cities all over the States, but Downtown LA is one of the most exciting. DTLA is diverse.

Located in famous Downtown Los Angeles. Close proximity to Little Tokyo, Arts District, Staples center and convention center. Nearby to Whole Foods and Ralphs grocery stores, and 3 blocks from the nearest metro, making it easy to get to Santa Monica beach, Universal studios and Pasadena without needing a car.

Originally built in 1914 as a hotel in the Old Bank District, the registered historical landmark El Dorado Lofts, was elegantly repurposed in 2010 into a perfect blend of classical architecture & modern living.

name: Smart Downtown 1BR w/ Gym, Doorman, near Metro Center, by Blueground
description:
Discover the best of Los Angeles, with this one-bedroom Downtown apartment. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this stylishly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#LAX348)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Los Angeles vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- 24/7 Security
- Pet Friendly
neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: Downtown Los Angeles (DTLA) offers world class attractions, incredible restaurants, a thriving nightlife and walkable streets. Historic Exposition Park is home to the California Science Center, the California African American Museum, the LA Memorial Coliseum and Sports Arena, and the Natural History Museum.

name: Arts District Private Room #235 w/Trundle Bed
description:
Affordable, practical and comfortable accommodations in the Arts District of Los Angeles! This private room comes with all the amenities you need for a great stay, in a charming century-old brick building with tons of character. Walk to hip Arts District, the culinary capital Little Tokyo, and take Gold Line Metro to explore rest of Los Angeles. Shared bathrooms and kitchen are cleaned daily. Friendly international vibe with lots of young professionals, students and travelers.

The space
Similar to dormitory style living, you get a private room (you won't share this with anybody unless you have 1 guest yourself) that is locked and share bathroom facilities and kitchen. The kitchen comes complete with cooking equipment, plates, glasses, etc. There is an atrium with laundry machines and another atrium to lock your bikes up. The common areas are cleaned each day. The room comes with a bed, mini fridge, desk, chair, and linens.

Guest access
You
neighborhood_overview: The area is ridiculously hip. Feel free to search "Arts District Los Angeles" and "Little Tokyo" to read up on the hood. Keep in mind that most parts of Los Angeles these days has a homeless problem. Downtown Los Angeles and its surrounding areas are not exempt. Luckily for us, we have a well lit building and a great security system.
host_about:
Zack Z. very much enjoys the arts–music especially. On the off time he (tries) to play guitar and puts his six years of choir and music theory into use. Aside from working online in the perpetually changing internet scene, Zack also works closely with his wife on artistic projects that will hopefully be the foundation of their traveling dreams together. 
 
Melissa M. is the epitome of hip and fresh.  A printmaker at heart, she thrives on the tactile that is paper. Together with this love of paper, and skills attained, she creates handmade artists books, prints, and stationery that evoke a thoughtful cuteness. 

Mel and Zack are a unique couple: met in high school, best friends for years, sharers of tragedy and fun times, singers of many a song, married immediately and always working on a mystery since then. 

The ultimate goal for them (and most 9 to 5'ers) is to make a living off doing what they both love. 

They hope to travel the world for extended periods of time and spread joy the only way they know how: funky dancing, loud singing, nonstop comedy and making pretty things.


OUR LISTINGS

Check them all out here: https://www.airbnb.com/s?host_id= (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) and our 10 bed place in a church here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6836730. Also our newest 3 bedroom house, here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/10775684

They are mostly all in the hippest part of Los Angeles, a place called Silver Lake (Northeast of Downtown). Homeplace of Beck, Elliott Smith, moustaches, The Silver Lake Reservoir, and heck, that dork pretty boy Ryan Gosling lives here too.

We've had the chance to meet and host the following artists and bands: Tame Impala, Blood Orange, Kurt Vile, American Football, Kimbra, King Tuff, The Movielife, Kopecky, Kate Nash, Slow Magic, Digitalism, Tanlines, Cathedrals, Lemaitre, The Stooges, Wild Feathers, Bronze Whale and more to come.

Some properties are owned by us but a few are also managed by us. Don't be surprised if we introduce you to a bff or a second mother of ours =)

Read our reviews and come join the fun!

neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Arts District Unfurnished Room 233
description:
Best value in exciting Arts District! Walk to the Gold Line, Little Tokyo, Arts District. Near public transport, great restaurants and bars. Private room, shared bath and kitchen cleaned daily. Must bring own furniture, we are renting this as an unfurnished room. Friendly international vibe!

The space
Similar to dormitory style living, you get a private room that is locked and share bathroom facilities and kitchen. The kitchen comes complete with cooking equipment, plates, glasses, etc. There is an atrium with laundry machines and another atrium to lock your bikes up. The common areas are cleaned each day.

Guest access
You are free to go anywhere but the roof, basement, closets outside of your room or other guests units (unless they invite you).

Other things to note
To save time back and forth, please message us in your first greeting with the following: full name, age, detailed reason for visit, employer, university
neighborhood_overview: The area is ridiculously hip. Feel free to search "Arts District Los Angeles" and "Little Tokyo" to read up on the hood. Luckily for us, we have a well lit building and a great security system.

name: THE ARTISTS WAREHOUSE Spacious. Unique. Fun.
description:
This is a unique work/live artistic space just outside downtown LA’s art district. The whole space would be yours on a monthly basis. I use it for music production, dance choreo, working out, & social media filming but it’s an awesome space for anything you can put your mind to. It comfortably sleeps 1-2 people but the work out space can be used for additional guests if needed (no additional beds provided). The outside area is industrial but is a 5 min Uber ride from all the cool spots downtown.

The space
Sub-leasing the entire space

Other things to note
Since the building is an industrial work/live space the other units are used for a number of different businesses. You can make a reasonable amount of noise but outside noises from other businesses sometimes can be heard. There is soundproofing which minimizes disturbances and the white noise from my in home air filter drowns out sounds when they are there. Outside noise isn’t a constant is

Great for photography and city shoots but isn't right for you if the urban industrial vibe isn't something you're comfortable with. name: Downtown Upscale loft
description:
Modern green soft loft in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles. Two blocks away from the staples center, LA Live and the convention center.

You will be living in South Park-the safest and most expensive part of downtown LA.

The space
You will have the whole loft to yourself. Remodeled loft with a modern barn door, a safe, closet, and access to the rest of the building. Nicely furnished and super clean.

There’s a total of two queen beds, including a Murphy bed in the living room/den, a comfortable couch to sleep an additional guest.

Guest access
24/7 concierge service, Swimming pool, hot tub, grills and Terrance area that includes a fireplace.

Other things to note
This is not a party loft even though you are encouraged to have fun. Music and noice level needs to be low after 9 pm.
However, this modern building has great sound proof to sleep comfortably.

host_about:

description:
I'd love to host you at my 1 bedroom, 1 bath condo with free parking in Downtown Los Angeles. This is one of the few Airbnb friendly buildings in Los Angeles. As a hotel, we have a small registration process that guests need to fill out.

My Condo Includes.
→ Secured parking for 1 vehicle
→ 740ft² / 68m² of space
→ Rooftop Pool, hot tub, cabana and gym
→ Walk Score 97 (dining, nightlife, cafes, shopping within walking distance)
→ In-unit washer + dryer
→ Netflix, Hulu, ESPN+ and Disney+ included

The space
My building requires all guests to provide a copy of a photo ID upon booking in order to be registered at the property.
Perfect for the solo traveler, couples, groups, families and those in town for business.

→ Onsite security 24 hours, 7 days a week
→ High-speed wifi with up to 200Mbps download speed
→ 65" TV with Roku and Netflix
→ Master bedroom includes a queen sized bed, fold out single

CVS is across the street for any of your needs.

6 blocks away from the nearest metro, making it easy to get to Santa Monica beach, Universal studios and Pasadena without having to drive.

description:
| Important To Read Before Booking |

Please see the "Other Things to Note" and "House Rules" sections for important details about booking same day, locals booking an Abode within their city of residence, COVID-19 visitor restrictions, current amenity limitations, (and more), before making your reservation.

We’re working hard to keep our Abodes safe and open to anyone who needs them. Check-in is seamless, with no lines to stand in or people to meet to ensure our guests can limit their interaction with others. We have implemented rigorous additional cleaning and sanitizing procedures before and after each stay, providing extra soap in the homes for personal hygiene, and fully stocked with cleaning supplies and paper goods. Our team is dedicated to assisting our guests and are available at any time, day or night.

| Highlights |

*Contactless check-in
*Professionally cleaned
*Virtual guest experience team available 24/7 via text, email
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of downtown LA's Theatre District & South Park where you will have no problems finding some of LA's top rated shows, concerts and not mention restaurants just footsteps away! Located a few blocks from downtown's famous Bottega Louie, you'll have access some of LA’s BEST food — head over to try one of its famous macaroons, fabulous mimosas or mouth-watering wood-fire pizzas and try to see if you'll be lucky enough to catch a glimpse of some of this fabulous social spot's frequent celebrity customers!

Looking for a "taste" of what some of downtown has to offer? Take a walk around the block and you're SURE to run into a movie, music-video or TV show being filmed!

The perfect spot for work or play as it is a convenient 10 minute walk away from Staples Center, Convention Center, and LA Live! Go see a Lakers, Clippers or Kings game at the Staples Center, see the newest exhibit at MOCA, a concert at Nokia Theatre, or an performance from the LA Philh
host_about: Abode gives guests convenient access to authentic living experiences in the most desirable neighborhoods. We bring together design, innovation, and next-level service to create exceptional spaces specifically designed for the modern traveler. Every Abode features crisp white sheets, fresh towels, and fully stocked kitchens and bathrooms. All with 24/7 service.

The Haas Building

name: Entire Premium Loft Downtown - Whole Foods close!
description:
Entire loft studio 2 blocks from whole foods, 2 blocks from my favorite coffee shop & rooftop view of sunset! Extra large east & west facing windows pouring beautiful light into both the living area & kitchen as well as the bedroom. The reflecting light from the skyscrapers gives this unit natural light all day! Fully furnished with vintage one-of-a-kind pieces I have collected over the years, the kitchen is packed with beautiful ceramics, cups & cookware. Washer/dryer inside unit!

The space
1040sq ft. Key faub entrance plus faub needed for elevator makes the premises secured and safe.

Rooftop access and she's a beauty. Almost every evening like clockwork I meet 2 friends on the roof to enjoy the sunset and either smoke a cigar or have a glass of whiskey...or both.

You'll love the large '80s leather reading chair and foot rest to cozy up and read a book or simply take a nap in.

Everyone loves the couch, it's rather photogenic a
neighborhood_overview: I chose this building for a reason. It's location is unmatched. 2 blocks from Whole Foods, not exaggerating, you're that close and it's very convenient. Living diagonal from Shake Shack can be deadly, a blessing and a curse. Next to shake shack is California Chickenafe for a bit healthier option and its other neighbor is Sweetgreen, very healthy, very delicious and I frequent there the most. Freehand hotel which is less than a block away has a beautiful rooftop bar and pool, great to enjoy the sunset for a change of pace and to be around some fun energy. 2 blocks away is iL Caffe my favorite downtown coffee shop & a really cool local hangout for the "cool kids." I'll have more recommendations for you when you stay. You're in good hands.
host_about:
I run a few e-commerce companies and do digital advertising and marketing consulting which all allows me to work remote and travel the world. I also invest in crypto and stocks and teach wealth building.

Love specialty coffee shops,  unique restaurants, a whiskey and cigar at sunset, fitness (yoga, pilates, running) and am passionate about film photography. 

Much love,
Nick

host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.
