name: Bright & airy DTLA loft w/ rooftop pool & hot tub
description:
Welcome to Esbie! This sunny, airy downtown LA studio loft has skyscraper views and a rooftop pool and hot tub -- an urban oasis with minimalist design, but plenty of amenities. Located in the Historic Core next to the Pershing Square Metro Station, this gentrifying DTLA neighborhood is diverse and dynamic, with trendy bars and restaurants next to cheap shops and taquerias.

The space
Esbie feels like a taste of New York City in the heart of DTLA, with high ceilings and big windows. Amenities include a Keurig coffee pod machine (with complimentary coffee pods), in-unit washer and dryer, a gym in the building, work desk, and fast wifi. There's a firm queen size bed, and a full size bed with memory foam mattress topper.

License number
HSR21-000599
neighborhood_overview: Located in the Historic Core of downtown LA -- or DTLA as the locals call it -- the neighborhood has an urban character similar to New York City: colorful, diverse, dynamic, and a melting pot of classes and culture. Trendy bars and restaurants share the same block as shops with cheap goods and greasy-spoon taquerias. Lots of hidden gems, and plenty to explore on foot, including the Grand Central Market, the Millennium Biltmore, the Bradbury Building, Pershing Square, the Broad Art Museum, SkySpace at the top of the U.S. Bank tower, and so much more!
host_about:
I'm an event producer based in San Francisco. Basically, I throw parties for a living (in fact, if you're in SF or LA on a Saturday night, I can put you on the guest list for Bootie Mashup, the long-running party I produce every week!) 

My professional and personal life keeps me out-of-town a lot, which isn't a bad thing, as I LOVE to travel. I stay at other Airbnbs wherever I go, and always treat the home the same way I hope guests treat my own place when I host.

Other random things about me (some of which you would probably figure out if you book my places): I'm a bit of an architecture geek and love tall buildings with views. I collect classic Atari 2600 videogames. I'm a DJ. I'm a sucker for mid-century modern design. I love pop culture and subculture. The older I get, the more picky I get about my coffee.

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled perfectly in between the Arts District and Little Tokyo, you are in the center of arguably the greatest Food and Shopping destination Los Angeles has to offer.
The Arts District has been the fastest growing neighborhood in LA for the last 5 years, and has a distinctly vibrant atmosphere you can't find anywhere else. Likened to Williamsburg in New York and Shoreditch in London, the Arts District is home to LA's leading culinary destinations such as Bestia, Bavel, Nightshade, and Manuela just to name a few. If you're a coffee fanatic there's no better place to stay - 3 of the greatest Roasters America has to offer are all within walking distance: Blue Bottle, Stumptown, and Verve are all within a mile of one another. If nightlife is more your speed, you'll be glad to know you're just steps away from two amazing Breweries, Arts District Brewing and Angel City Brewery, and countless bars that exude charisma and eccentricity.

perfect for young professionals, working remotely while enjoying dt.

neighborhood_overview:
Well, it's dtla, lots of things are happening all the time. My favorite quality of this room is the window that overlooks the main street, where every day something interesting happens. The same window views the Cecil Hotel entrance. lol.
* Please note that downtown LA is home to the homeless. if you feel uncomfortable with them please consider booking another place.
host_about:
My hosting experience started with Couchsurfing back in 2017, and it changed my perspective on traveling forever. There’s just so much more to it when you go to a building and talk to a person, rather than a commercial hotel with a receptionist. I personally prefer Airbnb mainly because it feels more humane. 
Let's be true to each other and create experiences worth remembering.
Cheers,

neighborhood_overview:
HISTORIC CORE

There's a reason why one of Downtown L.A.'s most vibrant districts is called the Historic Core. Located between Hill and Main Streets and 1st and 9th Streets, this eclectic neighborhood showcases many of the things that originally put Los Angeles on the world stage, including lovely parks, ornate movie palaces and other architectural marvels. It's also where visitors can experience places that have helped contribute to L.A.'s more contemporary reputation as a food and arts destination. With no shortage of beautiful buildings, cutting-edge art galleries, trendy bars and gourmet restaurants, the Historic Core is where L.A.'s golden era meets modern times.
host_about:
The Haas Building

The Haas Building is located at 219 West 7th Street, at the corner of Broadway and Seventh Street, in Historic Downtown Los Angeles, California. The building was originally owned by Abraham Haas of San Francisco; president of Haas, Baruch, & Company. The structure was made to be one of the finest and most modern buildings of the time. The building was constructed in the year (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , built with the latest steel frame and absolutely fireproof. Architectural firm Morgan, Walls & Clements designed this 12-story terra cotta business structure attractively facing the street with a frontage of 55 feet (17 m) on Broadway by 150 feet (46 m) on Seventh. The building was 50 by 75 feet (23 m) on the ground floor as well as the basement. The Haas Building was completed early (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) The interior woodwork was made in solid mahogany; the corridors were floored with marble with seven-foot marble wainscoting. The floor, walls and ceiling of the lobby were also made with marble. Including the three high-speed elevators that were installed, fixtures and interiors were said to have cost approximately $ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ]
The building had been given a complete makeover in the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s, with the classic exterior lost to brown metal panels. While much of the exterior brick and detail work was removed, the pieces around the entryway survived, though they were heavily damaged.
The Haas Building has undergone a complete remodel and has 68 live/work lofts. In addition, the top two floors of The Haas Building will be the home of the Haas PH, a multi-functional private event space. The 16,000-square-foot (1,500 m2) space has the feel of a modern boutique hotel with touches of its illustrious 99-year history throughout.

neighborhood_overview:
HISTORIC CORE

There's a reason why one of Downtown L.A.'s most vibrant districts is called the Historic Core. Located between Hill and Main Streets and 1st and 9th Streets, this eclectic neighborhood showcases many of the things that originally put Los Angeles on the world stage, including lovely parks, ornate movie palaces and other architectural marvels. It's also where visitors can experience places that have helped contribute to L.A.'s more contemporary reputation as a food and arts destination. With no shortage of beautiful buildings, cutting-edge art galleries, trendy bars and gourmet restaurants, the Historic Core is where L.A.'s golden era meets modern times.
host_about:
The Haas Building

The Haas Building is located at 219 West 7th Street, at the corner of Broadway and Seventh Street, in Historic Downtown Los Angeles, California. The building was originally owned by Abraham Haas of San Francisco; president of Haas, Baruch, & Company. The structure was made to be one of the finest and most modern buildings of the time. The building was constructed in the year (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , built with the latest steel frame and absolutely fireproof. Architectural firm Morgan, Walls & Clements designed this 12-story terra cotta business structure attractively facing the street with a frontage of 55 feet (17 m) on Broadway by 150 feet (46 m) on Seventh. The building was 50 by 75 feet (23 m) on the ground floor as well as the basement. The Haas Building was completed early (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) The interior woodwork was made in solid mahogany; the corridors were floored with marble with seven-foot marble wainscoting. The floor, walls and ceiling of the lobby were also made with marble. Including the three high-speed elevators that were installed, fixtures and interiors were said to have cost approximately $ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) ]
The building had been given a complete makeover in the (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) s, with the classic exterior lost to brown metal panels. While much of the exterior brick and detail work was removed, the pieces around the entryway survived, though they were heavily damaged.
The Haas Building has undergone a complete remodel and has 68 live/work lofts. In addition, the top two floors of The Haas Building will be the home of the Haas PH, a multi-functional private event space. The 16,000-square-foot (1,500 m2) space has the feel of a modern boutique hotel with touches of its illustrious 99-year history throughout.

My stylish 1-bedroom apartment has everything you need for your stay in the City of Angeles. The unit comes with a washer, a dryer, WiFi, a private balcony, and plenty more luxuries. There is a gym and pool located on the complex for your use, along with several grills for your outdoor cooking pleasure. You are located within driving distance to several popular restaurants, bars, and coffee shops. You are minutes from Dodger Stadium and all major highways. An ideal base to explore Los Angeles.

The space

- Full Kitchen

neighborhood_overview:
You a nestled in a resort like community just minutes from Downtown LA, Dodger Stadium, and the trendy Echo Park and Silverlake. There are coffee shops, food trucks, a pharmacy and convenient stores all within walking distance.

You are a 5 minute drive/Uber ride away from a wide array of culinary pleasures, covering all spectrum of dietary restrictions and needs. There is something for even the pickiest of eaters. Along with some great restaurants, you are also close to many great bars and breweries.

You are literally minutes from all major highways. You are approximately(Always depends on LA traffic) 5 minutes from the heart of Downtown, including The Staples Center, LA Live, and The Shops at Fig. You are 15 minutes away from Hollywood and the infamous Hollywood sign. For a great night out or amazing shopping you can head just 15-20 mins down the 101 to West Hollywood and Beverly Hills.

One-of-a-kind, designer loft within the heart of Downtown Los Angeles.

neighborhood_overview:
There are numerous nicknames for Los Angeles, just as there are various vibes within this sprawling city. Between rugged mountains and sandy shorelines, a laid-back surf culture and a high-powered commercial district, and food trucks and some of the world’s top-rated, five-star restaurants, Los Angeles features diversity in every aspect possible. Somehow, all of the pieces of this city fit together seamlessly, making Los Angeles the unique destination we know and love. From Rodeo Drive and Beverly Hills to Hollywood and Chinatown, there is the perfect neighborhood for everyone in Los Angeles.

From celebrity sightings to unbeatable shopping destinations, Los Angeles is hard to beat. Enjoy a hike in the Santa Monica Mountains, Griffith Park, or Topanga State Park, enjoy the famous entertainment at Universal Studios Hollywood, see the stars along the legendary Hollywood Walk of Fame, or stop in to the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

name: Downtown Los Angeles Industrial Brick Loft!
description:
This unique brick embedded loft has a style all its own - located in the heart of the Historic Core in Downtown Los Angeles experience the perfect place to stay for a night in the city! You are in an unparalleled location just steps away from gourmet restaurants, trendy bars/clubs, and some great shopping options! You are also within walking distance to FIDM and a few miles away from the illustrious USC. If you love the city life you will feel perfectly at home right here!

The space
Our historic loft is the perfect place to stay in the city that is the epitome of creativity and practicality while in the middle of Downtown Los Angeles!

Amongst our building amenities: rooftop pool/hot tub, gym, on premise underground parking, and 24 hour host availability.

We have a fully stocked upgraded stainless steel kitchen that has everything you need to enjoy a delicious dinner during your stay which includes: pots/pans, utensils, cutlery, bowls, plate

host_about:
Hey! 

Me and my girlfriend are thrilled to welcome guests from around the world to our incredible industrial loft in DTLA! It's just the kind of place that we would want to stay if we were visiting Los Angeles. We enjoy meeting interesting, creative, and passionate people from near and far sharing our love of LA with them - the history, food, art, architecture, and music. We are relaxed and welcoming so staying with us is like staying with friends or family! In our travels we have realized the place you stay in while visiting a destination can make or break an experience. 

That said, we try really hard to make each guests stay wonderfully memorable. We're just one call or message away so please don't hesitate to reach out for any concerns  :)

host_about: I have been an airbnb host for 7 years now and most of those a Superhost. I know what it takes to make sure your trip is amazing so I equipped all of my properties as if they were an actual home. There's nothing your would need to bring with you! I love to travel and have deep passion for culture. I've been all over the world to France, Brazil, the Ivory Coast, Africa, Panama, Puerto RIco, Jamaica and many other beautiful places. I want your stay to be enjoyable for you as well as for me. Take care of the apartment you are staying in. Please read the HOUSE RULES below carefully and follow them to avoid additional charges or cancelation of the reservation:

You are just around the corner from China town, Downtown LA, Staples and countless places and spots that will blow your mind. At the end of the day we just want you to enjoy your stay.

The space
4 guests · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths ·

LIVING AREA
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION & GETTING AROUND:
-Located in Downtown LA
-It is less than a mile from trendy bars and restaurants and just off the freeway that takes you into Hollywood.
-It's downtown LA so there are plenty of bus stops as well as union station 2 miles away. But in LA a car is very necessary!

Parking Options:
-Metered street parking in front of building from 8am-6pm
Parking in LA:
Please note LA is famous for its parking restraints. Read signs very carefully. Do not park where the curb is Red, Yellow or Green or in front of or near a fire hydrant... You will get towed.

Guests will have access up to 1 car garage parking at an additional $35.00/day charge per car. (Please inquire about availability)

host_about: Hi, my name is Xavier. I was born and bred in Seattle, WA but have lived all over the country, from Raleigh, NC to Los Angeles, where I currently live. I was a college football quarterback and was pre-med before moving to Los Angeles back in 2011.  I am in the entertainment industry and in marketing. I love the outdoors, staying fit and going to concerts. The best part of living in Los Angeles is the vast amount of experiences that this city has to offer. I love to travel and meet new people which has led me to hosting here on Airbnb. We are the product of our experiences, using Airbnb as a guest and host has led to more experiences and connections than I could have possibly imagined.

neighborhood_overview:
The Broadway Theater District in the Historic Core of Downtown Los Angeles is the first and largest historic theater district in the US. With twelve movie palaces located along a six-block stretch of Broadway, it is the only large concentration of movie palaces left in the United States.

Location, location, location. The loft is situated in the heart of downtown right next to the famous Ace Hotel and one block over from the brand new Apple Store that resides in the historic Tower Theater. There are restaurants, coffee shops, rooftop, bars and clubs all within walking distance. Staples Center and LA live is a 10 minute walk west and the Fashion District/Santee Alley is right around the corner. If you feel like staying in for a night you’ll enjoy the rooftop pool and jacuzzi with 360 views of downtown.

We built Zeus Living so you can feel at home wherever opportunity takes you. Whether it’s for a month, a year, or sometime in between, you can count on a thoughtfully designed home and a comfortable, easy stay. Our technology helps us select homes you’ll love in ideal locations at a good value, while our expert team handles all the details. Based in San Francisco, and operating in the Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Boston, and Washington, D.C.


** 
PLEASE NOTE: Many of our homes are pet friendly, which you will see listed under "House Rules". If you do plan to bring your furry friend(s), we have a one-time non-refundable $500 pet fee and have a limit of 2 pets max. We have several dog breed restrictions. Most of our dog-friendly homes do not allow American Pit bulls, Rottweilers, Akitas, Cane Corsos, Presa Canarios, Bull Mastiffs, Staffordshire Terriers, Dobermans, German Shepherds, Boxers, Malamutes, Huskies, Dalmatians, Chow Chows, Fila Brasileiros, or Wolf hybrids. We encourage individuals with service animals or one of the breeds listed as restricted to contact us before booking.

name: Enjoy Downtown LA Luxury Living at Its Finest!
description:
Nestled right on Broadway, this chic luxury condo is the perfect place for work or play – centrally located and full of amenities. A prime DTLA location boasts close proximity to the Staple Center, Walt Disney Concert Hall, Grand Central Market and so much more.

Resort-style amenities make you feel right at home, including a fitness center, theater, private dining room, business center and more. Grab your friends and head to the rooftop pool to lounge and soak in the panoramic city views.

The space
No matter how long you stay with us, you will feel right at home in this chic, stylish, and fully equipped condo. Enjoy a sun-soaked open concept entertainment space, contemporary design, and curated furnishings that welcome you into the space.

Countless amenities await you including an in-unit washer/dryer, high-speed fiber optic cable, 70” smart TV, free parking and so much more. Start your morning with a cup of coffee from your Nespresso or t
neighborhood_overview:
THE HEART OF CITY:
The spotlight still shines on Broadway, a street rooted in the Golden Age of theater and film with a history and heritage unlike any other. Beautifully urban with authentic Angeleno soul and character. A vibrant neighborhood full of emerging culinary destinations, boutique shopping, theater, music and art for endless excursions and experiences.

THE CITY AT YOUR DOOR
From Grand Central Market to the Ace Hotel, Perla’s central setting gives you an all-access pass to eclectic Downtown living. And just steps to the light rail, all of Los Angeles is within easy reach for commuting or weekend outings.

description:
The apartment is located in Downtown LA Fashion District near by Staples and Convention Center. 1 minute walk from Grand Ave Blue line metro station and down the street from Los Angeles Trade Technical College. The apartment comes furnished with full size bed, private bathroom and full size kitchen. The place also has WiFi and Cable TV. It's a vintage complex that was built in the 1900's. Parking lot is located across the street. You can reserve a parking spot at $150/month.

name: Palatial Penthouse & Personal Outdoor Living Space
description:
| Important To Read Before Booking |

Please see the "Other Things to Note" and "House Rules" sections for important details about booking same day, locals booking an Abode within their city of residence, COVID-19 visitor restrictions, current amenity limitations, (and more), before making your reservation.

We’re working hard to keep our Abodes safe and open to anyone who needs them. Check-in is seamless, with no lines to stand in or people to meet to ensure our guests can limit their interaction with others. We have implemented rigorous additional cleaning and sanitizing procedures before and after each stay, providing extra soap in the homes for personal hygiene, and fully stocked with cleaning supplies and paper goods. Our team is dedicated to assisting our guests and are available at any time, day or night.

| Highlights |

*Contactless check-in
*Professionally cleaned
*Virtual guest experience team available 24/7 via text, email
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of downtown LA's Theatre District & South Park where you will have no problems finding some of LA's top rated shows, concerts and not mention restaurants just footsteps away! Located a few blocks from downtown's famous Bottega Louie, you'll have access some of LA’s BEST food — head over to try one of its famous macaroons, fabulous mimosas or mouth-watering wood-fire pizzas and try to see if you'll be lucky enough to catch a glimpse of some of this fabulous social spot's frequent celebrity customers!

Looking for a "taste" of what some of downtown has to offer? Take a walk around the block and you're SURE to run into a movie, music-video or TV show being filmed!

The perfect spot for work or play as it is a convenient 10 minute walk away from Staples Center, Convention Center, and LA Live! Go see a Lakers, Clippers or Kings game at the Staples Center, see the newest exhibit at MOCA, a concert at Nokia Theatre, or an performance from the LA Philh
host_about: Abode gives guests convenient access to authentic living experiences in the most desirable neighborhoods. We bring together design, innovation, and next-level service to create exceptional spaces specifically designed for the modern traveler. Every Abode features crisp white sheets, fresh towels, and fully stocked kitchens and bathrooms. All with 24/7 service.

Modern luxury comes to life in this thoughtfully decorated and inspiring studio apartment with its floor-to-ceiling windows, upscale furnishings, and open floor plan. The dining table can double as a work station, by connecting your laptop with an HDMI cable to the TV. Whether in town for business or leisure, travelers of all types will feel right at home. Situated in the heart of Downtown LA, you’ll be steps away from the the action and some of LA’s best restaurants, sites, and stadiums.

The space
- High Speed WiFi
- Rooftop Lounge
- Fitness Center
- Bike Lockers
- Business Center

Take in the views from the observatory rooftop lounge, relax by the zero-edge pool, or dine on the sundeck. The two-story fitness center is fully equipped to help you stay on top of your wellness routine.

name: (#6805) 2BR Apartment in Los Angeles
description:
At Zeus we design move-in ready homes and fully manage them ourselves, therefore guaranteeing you responsive customer care and a great overall experience. Get in touch to discuss what makes us different or book this home now!

Enjoy a stay with Zeus! We have 4955+ reviews (see below).

The space
At Zeus, we offer thoughtfully furnished homes for 30+ day stays.

Our homes come equipped with handpicked essentials, from premium mattresses and linens to kitchen basics like pots and pans, chef’s knives, and wine glasses. Your home is also equipped with high-speed WiFi and cleaning supplies like dish soap, paper towels, a vacuum, and laundry detergent so you’ll have everything you need from the moment you arrive. Your Zeus home is warm, comfortable, and ready for living.

In the event that you plan to bring your furry friend(s), please note that we charge a one-time non-refundable pet fee of $500. See our host profile for breed restrict
host_about:
We built Zeus Living so you can feel at home wherever opportunity takes you. Whether it’s for a month, a year, or sometime in between, you can count on a thoughtfully designed home and a comfortable, easy stay. Our technology helps us select homes you’ll love in ideal locations at a good value, while our expert team handles all the details. Based in San Francisco, and operating in the Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Boston, and Washington, D.C.


** 
PLEASE NOTE: Many of our homes are pet friendly, which you will see listed under "House Rules". If you do plan to bring your furry friend(s), we have a one-time non-refundable $500 pet fee and have a limit of 2 pets max. We have several dog breed restrictions. Most of our dog-friendly homes do not allow American Pit bulls, Rottweilers, Akitas, Cane Corsos, Presa Canarios, Bull Mastiffs, Staffordshire Terriers, Dobermans, German Shepherds, Boxers, Malamutes, Huskies, Dalmatians, Chow Chows, Fila Brasileiros, or Wolf hybrids. We encourage individuals with service animals or one of the breeds listed as restricted to contact us before booking.

name: Beautiful Downtown Loft w/ Gym & W/D, next to Broad Museum, by Blueground
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Los Angeles with this lovely studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Downtown home. (#LAX532)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this studio property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Los Angeles vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:

- 24/7 Security
- Pet Friendly
- Gym
- Roof Deck

- Elevator

Other things to note</
neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

description:
Welcome to my beautiful & well appointed suite in the heart of Los Angeles. Rooftop pool, hot tub & GYM with even better views! GREAT location, close to everything! As a hotel, we have a small registration process that guests need to fill out.

→ Secured parking for 1 vehicle
→ 750ft² / 70m² of space
→ Rooftop Pool and patio, hot tub, cabana and gym
→ Walk Score 97 (dining, nightlife, cafes, shopping within walking distance)
→ In-unit washer + dryer

The space
My building requires all guests to provide a copy of a photo ID upon booking in order to be registered at the property.

Homey atmosphere 1 bedroom 1 bathroom condo which offers a view of Broadway street. Perfect for the solo traveler, couples, groups, families and those in town for business.

→ Gorgeous City View from the rooftop
→ Onsite security 24 hours, 7 days a week
→ High-speed Wi-Fi!
→ Smart TV which you can access YouTube and Netflix

Located in the famous Downtown Los Angeles.
6 blocks away from the Staples center and convention center.

CVS is across the street for any of your needs.

6 blocks away from the nearest metro, making it easy to get to Santa Monica beach, Universal studios and Pasadena without having to drive

host_about: I decided to move to Los Angeles from London 7 years ago after I fell in love with the city while on vacation. Los Angeles is truly a great city that is diverse with countless sunny days and so many things to do and see. In Los Angeles there are many great people from different cultures and from all over the world. I truly enjoy meeting people and learning. I personally lived in 3 different countries and able to get along with everyone. I am easy going and my goal is to continue traveling. Also, my aim is to deliever 5 star with comfort and cleanliness at a great location. I am sure you will fall in love with L.A. too. Please let me know if you have any questions. I look forward to being your host.

name: Deluxe Downtown 1BR w/ Pool, Gym & W/D near Staples Center, by Blueground
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Los Angeles with this sophisticated one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Downtown home. (#LAX550)

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Los Angeles, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- 24/7 Security
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
- Outdo
neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Lovely 1 bedroom open loft concept with fireplace.
description:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located unit in the heart of downtown Los Angeles, CA. This unique open loft concept is decorated with a rich eclectic vibe for the artistic side in you. Owned by a filmmaker, this apartment is wonderful to enjoy quiet nights or host a small group of friends while watching your favorite shows. It truly is a gem to work and play in a very central location that is walking distance to literally everything you could possibly need or want. Guaranteed!

The space
You will love the uniqueness of this apartment with its vibrant colors and trendy decor. It comes with high speed internet to do your work or access all your favorite streaming platforms on a 80” inch High Resolution Sony TV. The unit has a fully equipped large kitchen to host guests with a cute little corner bar with a neon light. It’s been an incredible place to host friends and family. It has 2 full bathrooms to ensure your primary bathroom remains private.
neighborhood_overview: Pretty much everything in downtown. It’s located on the corner of 7th and Hope, right across from the Sheraton downtown. name: Hip Downtown 1BR w/ W/D, Pool & Gym, next to Broad Museum, by Blueground (LAX 536)
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cheery Downtown furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and pretty living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Los Angeles has to offer! (#LAX536)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Los Angeles vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Pet Friendly
- Swimming Pool
- Gym
neighborhood_overview: Located in DTLA, this furnished apartment invites you to explore the heart of one of LA’s fastest-growing neighborhoods. Today, the area represents the central business district of the city and hosts the Los Angeles Convention Center (LACC), a world-class convention and exhibition space. From museums, like The Broad, to restaurants and bars in the Historic Core or concerts and sporting events in South Park, this modern metropolis offers a well-balanced blend of business and pleasure. Among the top attractions of the area is the Walt Disney Concert Hall. Some people say that the experience of hearing a performance in its main hall is like being inside a violin. The Arts District and Chinatown are also two of the trendiest spots in Los Angeles with new restaurants and nightlife options.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: DTLA Loft with Front Desk Security
description:
Enjoy a stylish downtown Los Angeles experience at this centrally-located unit. Conveniently near restaurants, bars, and within walking distance to Whole Foods and CVS. Down the street from the Crypto.com Arena for easy access (but unit is facing into the terrace so you will not be disturbed by events).

Floor-to-ceiling windows provide lots of sunlight during the day and a sparkling city view at night. Unit is furnished and ready to live in - great for a working and/or creative professional.

The space
A loft unit with high ceilings and an alcove for the bedroom area. Walls are thick so minimal noise from neighbors. Floor-to-ceiling windows provide natural light with adjustable roller shades.

Guest access
The unit comes with a single parking space (full transparency - it is rather small - LA parking standards, whatcha gonna do). There is ample metered street parking on surrounding streets.
neighborhood_overview:
South Park is a modern and vibrant neighborhood in Downtown Los Angeles. A main attraction is the Los Angeles Convention Center and STAPLES Center (a multi-use arena that is home to the Lakers, Clippers, and Kings, as well as entertainment events and concerts). Adjacent is L.A. LIVE, an entertainment and dining complex with two dozen bars and restaurants centered by the open-air, brightly lit Microsoft Square, and surrounded by the Microsoft Theater, Grammy Museum, and Lucky Strike Bowling Alley.

Within a walkable half-mile, there is a diverse selection of food, drink, and game-changing craft beer options. Also, along the route, find the highly regarded Faith & Flower and Broken Spanish.
